loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata borrowed a loan and used it in her business. She has a tailoring business where she makes rugs of different sizes and patterns. Aside from her tailoring business, she also has a variety store and sells frozen and processed foods. Her income from the loan is helpful in their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband, who works as a driver, are helping each other to provide for their family and  manage their household. 
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Donata dreams to be successful both in life and business. She hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the 'Word of God' she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulinaz

texts.en: Gulinaz is a 53-year-old woman. She lives alone in a small village of the Kareli district. Gulinaz is unemployed now. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, she decided to start a clothing trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. Gulinaz received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and the Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start their businesses.  With the loan of $ 1,200, she will purchase clothing at a wholesale price and sell them in her community door-to-door.  Her regular customers will be her neighbors.  She plans to sell a wide assortment and well-priced clothing for men, women and children.  It is obvious that the job is hard for Gulinaz, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a lady of fifty-one years, is married to James and is a mother of two children. She sells cereal and has been doing so for six years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Jane's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of cereals.  In the future she wants to improve her family's standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase variety of cereals like beans etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is thirty two years old, married to Irene and a father of two children. He sells cosmetics in Kangemi and has been in this business for two years now. John receives a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be John's first loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy cosmetics for sale.  In the future he wants to improve his family's standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase different types of cosmetics.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a man of fifty seven years and is married to Esther.  He runs a butchery and has been in this business for thirteen years now. Benson gets a monthly income of twenty three thousand shillings.

This will be Benson's third loan with KADET LTD.  He has repaid all other loans successfully and he plans to use the entire loan to buy meat for his business.  In the future he wants to improve his family's standards of living.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is  married with 7 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living while her husband is farming, the main source of income.  She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Her previous loan was used in her retail store was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 9,000 PHP to buy dried fish for sale in addition to her inventory working capital. She plans to use the profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish for sale in addition to her inventory working capital.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en: Ketevan is a 53-year-old woman. She lives in the capital city of Georgia with her two children and a pensioner father-in-law. Her children go to the local school. Ketevan trades with clothing and needs money for purchasing a stock. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $ 600 for purchasing the stock. As the stock of clothing is purchased, she will offer her clients more assortment and will generate more income. With the increased income she will provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing.

loans.name: Armend

texts.en: Armend is 25 years old, single and lives with his entire family. He is a hard woker who enjoys being employed as a waiter in an exclusive restaurant and likes to help his family. It is for this reason he wanted to do some renovations to the house. Armend is requesting a loan for the first time in order to renovate his house and the façade. This loan will help him a lot, because without this help, he would not manage to assist and contribute to his family. In the future, he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family and is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: christine est une femme de 46 ans, marié et mère de 6 enfants. elle cuisine et vend des bâtons de manioc depuis 9 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant des tubercules de manioc en gros afin d’accroître les ventes et les bénéfices. les profits générés vont être réinjectés dans l'activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Christine is a 46-year-old woman, married and mother of six children. For the past nine years she has cooked and sold cassava roots in one of the city's neighborhoods.

She is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of raw ingredients by buying cassava tubers wholesale. This will increase her sales and profits, which will be reinvested to expand her business activity.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients (cassava)

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en:
Miranda is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and pensioner father-in-law. The only source of income for her family is the grocery store which Miranda runs. 

Miranda needs money to purchase stock. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $500 to purchase a stock of groceries. This will increase the turnover of her grocery store and thus increase the income of Miranda's family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries

loans.name: Vesel

texts.en:
Vesel, 45, lives in the southern part of Kosovo. He is married and the father of six children. His wife stays at home taking care of the house and the children, while Vesel works as a guard in order to earn a living. 

A few years ago, they started to build a new house but, since the money he generates through his employment is not enough to finish the house, Vesel is requesting a loan to pay for the installation of water in their new house. He hopes that the loan will improve their standard of living and make life easier for his family. Vesel is very appreciative of this help and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: To install water in their new house

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Aloyce, aged in his late 30s, is married with four children three of whom are in school. For six years now, Aloyce has been running two activities: he is a bread supplier and also provides a motorcycle service. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. supplying bread and from then to 11 p.m. provides a motorcycle service. He is doing really well in his businesses and is able to make a good profit per month.
 
This will be Aloyce's eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to replace his old motorcycle by buying a new one and to supply more bread. Aloyce has successfully repaid all his previous loans. With the business profit that he has earned, he has covered his children's school fees and food expenses, and has built a house. Aloyce will use this loan to pay for his motorcycle maintenance. He dreams that one day he will be able to provide for a better education for his children.
 
Aloyce will share this loan with his loan group "Tegemeo" which has four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Selda

texts.en:
Selda runs a women’s clothing store that is far from the city center. Although doing this job for six years, she has only made a slight increase in revenue. She says it has been a long time since she was able to buy new clothing. This loan will allow Selda to buy new goods for the shop. She was excited by the news that a school will be opening near her shop so she hopes to stock up on clothing that young  people would like. 

Selda and her retired husband do not have any children. Because her  life has been rather difficult, now she hopes that with this loan she will be able to secure a comfortable old age. As a person who supports her friends, she feels there is nothing that she cannot do, especially with the support of a Kiva loan.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff  
Selda Hanım  şehrin  uzağında  kalan  iş  merkezinde  kadın  kıyafetleri  satan  bir  mağaza  işletiyor.Altı yıldır  bu  işi  yaparak  az  da  olsa  kazanç  elde  ettiği  dükkanına  mal  alabilmek  için  mikro  kredi alıyor.Yakın  zamanda  dükkanının  bulunduğu  yere  açılacak  olan  okulun  haberiye  umutlanan  Selda  Hanım gençlerin  tercih  edeceği  kıyafetler  almak  istiyor.Uzun  zamandır  dükkanına  yeni  mal  alamadığını söylüyor.Emekli  eşiyle  birlikte  yaşayan  Selda  Hanımın  çocuğu  yok.Zor  bir  hayatı  olan  Selda  Hanımın  hayalinde  sakin  ve  huzurlu  bir  yaşlılık  var.Arkadaşlarına  her  zaman  destek  olan  Selda Hanım  inanarak  ve  calısarak  yapamayacağı  hiçbir  şey  olmadığını  düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy new goods for the shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives and works close to Kakamega town in Kakamega county which is famous for its rainforest and is located in Western Kenya. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega rainforest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Wilson is married and has eight children. His wife works as a businesswoman while Wilson currently farms their land. He has been farming for 40 years, and is currently growing maize, sugar cane, sorghum, and sweet potatoes on his plot. 

This is Wilson’s first loan with Kiva. He plans to use the income from his hives to pay his children’s college fees and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives and works on a farm outside of Kakamega town. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Philip is married, and has fourteen children. He has been farming for fifty years, and is currently growing vegetables and bananas on his land. He likes beekeeping because it is an easy to manage activity that does not require strain or hard work. 

This is Philip’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to educate his last-born, who is still in secondary school.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and sewing tools.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, aged 32, is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband as he wants to start offering barbecued food in the evening to the common people of his area. To start this food business, he needs a grill, coal, beef and a stall. In the morning, he works in a restaurant, but due to increases in expenses, he wants to start selling barbecued food in the evening. 

Nasreen hopes that the lender will show their warmth by supporting her as through this stall her husband would be able to earn more income than before. She says thank you to Kiva and the team from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy beef, coal, a grill and a stall to sell barbecued food.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun, aged 49, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns an income of $5 each day. Her children are employed and earn about $13 daily. 

Due to the difficulties of her family’s transportation, Nun is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Huy operates a rice farming business to generate income and is also involved in raising poultry at home. She is 77 and a mother of five adult children. Huy and her husband have a good cooperation in managing their rice farming with support from their sons and daughters. Having been involved in this occupation for years, she is able to make a net profit of $4.00 per day.

Huy has been a client of HKL for five loan cycles already. The prior loans she had were a great help to contribute to the development of her farming business as well as her living standards. 

She has applied for another loan to buy a motorcycle, which will be used to serve her household's transportation needs. She believes that the loan will help her to improve her living status. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her with which she was able to buy more products and ingredients for her food stall. It also helped in her direct selling business. She continues to work to provide for her family.
 
Janet would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan so she can purchase raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janet dreams that her family will always be in good health and hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 54 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her small retail shop, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and start collecting charcoal from the forest on her own rather than sending other people to do that for her. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on their standards of living. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 39 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a security guard who makes an income of $5 daily. One of her children is also employed in a garment factory. She earns about $3 each day. 

Due to the lack of funds, Mom is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Qendrim

texts.en:
Qendrim is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for supporting his business by giving him a loan so he could purchase wholesale chestnuts for his food stand. As a mobile food seller in his area, he sells ice-cream in the summer and chestnuts in the winter. He is very satisfied with the previous loan as he said he made a lot of profit last year selling chestnuts. 

Qendrim is requesting a second loan for the same business and for the same purpose of buying chestnuts wholesale. The loan will again help him to continue his business as his future goal is to open a shop, expanding his business even more. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support of his second loan!

loans.use: To buy chestnuts wholesale

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vicent is a tea-grower in Nyakabare-Mashonga-Kyamuhunga and he has done tea-growing since 2006. It is his sole source of income and he says it has helped him a lot since he gets money from it to cater for the needs of his family. He has three children aged five, three and two. He believes that they will get a quality education if he is given the loan. 

He will use the loan to get more profit after he puts the loan money of 1,000,000 UGX to proper use (buying fertilizers). His clients are the tea traders in the area and he believes he will be financially stable and be able to pay tuition for his children on time despite the challenging dry season which he experiences sometimes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 45, a mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is a very hardworking and honest person. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods two times a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning good profits from the restaurant business. Nasreen cooks all the dishes at home and her husband sells them at his restaurant. He also offers tea to his customers.

Now he wants to grow his business and wants to offer more menus to his customers. But he does not have money to buy more food items to cook and offer. Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more food items such as beef, pulses, chicken etc, so that he can earn more profit.

Nasreen says thank to Kiva and appreciates the warm support given to her.

loans.use: To buy flour, pulses, vegetables, beef and chicken for the restaurant.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Ester owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She also manages her vegetable garden to earn an additional income. Her previous loan taken from GDMPC was used in her farm and was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she took a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a new variety of seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. In the future, Ester wants to improve her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja lives in a small village in a minority community with her husband and three children: two girls and one boy. Sanja is a hardworking woman who works a lot to earn a living; she is working hard on her land together with her husband. Sanja  runs an agricultural business and uses the tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and charge a service fee for the work. This will significantly increase the family's income, and the increased income will enable her husband to do administrative work in a school.  

She plants peppers, wheat and corn and then she sells them in a market. She is requesting a loan for the first time to buy an agricultural machine that is larger than the one that she has now in order to make her work easier and more efficient. The loan will help with these activities, and therefore the family's living conditions will improve. With the increased income, they will be able to expand their agricultural business. Sanja  wanted to thank all of the lenders at Kiva for their kindness and generous support.

loans.use: To buy an agricultural machine.

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Meet Unice. She is in her late forties and is from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with two children. In 2008, Unice established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a transportation problem as travel from one village to another is very difficult.

Unice requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Unice plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara is 43 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $8 per day. 

Nara is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to school. This purchase will help her children easily get to school on time and will reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand the business in construction and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to school.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 48 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction for more than five years, earning approximately $5 each day. Three of his children are construction workers or garment workers. They earn about $13 daily. 

To provide enough space for the family’s living, Son is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a plot of land with a house. This money will help him to improve his family’s living conditions. In the future, he would like to run an additional business and help his children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land with a house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop such as sugar and salt to sell, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and improving her family's standards of living. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to be a powerful entrepreneur. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faridah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop such as sugar and salt.

loans.name: Rudolof

texts.en:
Rudolf is a 53-year-old man who is married to Ivoni, a 40-year-old woman. They are blessed with four children, namely: Netsy, 24, a teacher; Lafri, 22, a private company employee; Andri, 19, a university student; Wandi, 17, a vocational senior high school student. 

Rudolf has been running a dried corn selling business since 1996. He initiated this business using his own capital in the amount of 100,000 IDR. At that time Rudolf was not just selling corn but also various type of nuts as well as coconut oil. As time went by, Rudolf made up his mind to focus on selling dried corn alone, with various options such as dried corn for daily basis consumption and dried corn as animal fodder. The need to restock the dried corn has led him to apply for a loan from TLM in amount of 4,500,000 IDR.

The loan is spent on various types of dried corn for daily consumption and dried corn as animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy corn, chaff and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Tumennast

texts.en:
Mr. Tumennast, 69 years old, lives with his wife in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife both have retired from work and get a state pension.

Even though he had retired, he can't sit idle, so he decided to render a taxi service to local people using his car. He has been driving his car around the city for almost five years.

He is requesting a loan of 4,300,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as wallpapers, fiberglass, bricks and foam in order to renovate his old house in preparation for the coming winter. As a result, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about getting cold. Also they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Ol is 55 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $12 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Ol is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 63 and a widowed mother of six adult children. She currently lives in small village of Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She is involved in a rice-farming business, primarily growing rice on a seasonal basis, and also raises pigs for additional income. During the period of her entrepreneurship, she expanded her business and now earns a good income.

Em is a hard-working woman, and this quality helps her to be involved in several types of agricultural activities. She wants to obtain this loan to invest in the purchase of piglets for fattening and a few sacks of feed. She hopes to sell them at a profitable price when they become mature. She hopes to get this loan and thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase of piglets for fattening and a few sacks of feed.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 33 years old. She has a common law relationship with a noble man and has two dependent children.

To earn a living, this couple is dedicated to farming crops, primarily rice, which she harvests and sells into the markets of the province. Farming has been the sole source of her income and she has been doing this for more than 10 years.

This time Mao would like to acquire a loan amounting to 1,500,000 KHR, which she will use to pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice and to cover other costs of farming. Her goal is to increase her production and thereby increase her household income.  She thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice and to cover other costs of farming

loans.name: Chuy

texts.en:
Chuy is 30 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife is also a construction worker who makes an income of $4 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Chuy requests a loan of $1000 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his work in construction and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 55 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $4 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Thon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn higher educations.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Mabinty from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child aged three months. In 2010, Mabitny established a retail business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained to do business. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Mabitny requires a loan in order to purchase rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mabitny plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is aged 31; she is young and a newly married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

At the time when she got married she found that her husband’s income is very poor and he is unable to bear the entire household expenses alone.  Sultana decided to start her tailoring business at home so that she could bring in income to feed her children. She has been sewing ladies' clothes for many years and earning a reasonable amount to run the household. But nowadays her sewing machine has become out of order and she wants to buy new sewing machine but she does not have money.

Therefore, Sultana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can buy a new sewing machine. She hopes that she will find good customers and can sew impressive designs for them soon.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 31 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Shamshad’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shamshad has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shamshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past four years, has been running a business selling cloth. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Ameena is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. Ameena expects boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Isata from Jui in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 3 and 6 years.

For over 10 years, Isata has established her food commodities business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that her major hardship is slow sales during the rainy season.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Isata plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her daughter. 

It is already three years that Shushanik has been involved in the retail business. She sells different type of perfumes to locals in Vanadzor town and earns her living. As the only bread winner in the family, Shushanik works hard to be able to sustain her daughter’s living. Currently, for purchasing new stock of perfume, Shushanik has no financial resources. She is asking a loan to purchase perfumes to sell to her clients.
 
Shushanik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is very important for Shushanik to be able to continue her retail business and improve her living conditions. She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for perfumes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is aged 36 years; she is a responsible and hard-working lady.  She does not have baby, she has been checked by many specialists but in vain.

She has been running a business selling ladies clothes at home for many years. Most of her customers come from the nearby town. Ladies come to her house; she offers various types of fabrics to them. Most of her customers also demand gent’s clothes also but she does not have sufficient money to buy gent’s clothes to sell. Her husband is doing job in a firm; he is very impressed and happy with her.

Yasmeen requested a loan to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can buy gent’s clothes to sell. With the profit amount she will get better treatment from a specialist doctor so that God bless her with a child. Yasmeen seems happy to take a loan.

loans.use: To buy gent's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 55-year-old woman. She lives alone in a small village of Senaki district. Marine works as a sales person at a local supermarket and earns 200 GEL per month. As the existing income is not enough for her, she decided to start her own business and requested a loan. 

The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to purchase clothing. She will purchase clothing from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price.

loans.use: to begin trading clothing.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena, age 45, deals in the business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income.  She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Ebenezer's Group

texts.en:
Ebenezer is the featured borrower of this Group. He has always been neighbors and friends with the other group member.

Ebenezer is a 41-year-old married father of one. He has been selling material and bags for five years at the central market. He has very good experience in his domain. That is why he is acquiring a loan of GHS 2,000 from Kiva partner ID Ghana to buy materials and bags to sell to his customers. This loan will improve both his business and his family situation.

Ebenezer is on the left in the photograph and Janet, who sells underwear, is standing on the right in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy materials and bags and sell to customers.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 52-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, Shahida has requested a loan of PKR 25,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower prices. In doing so, she will be able to meet her customers' increasing demand consistently. She will use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in the Senaki district. Her children go to the local school and her husband works at the local museum. He is paid 400 GEL per month. This income is not enough for her family, so Marina decided to start a business selling clothes. 

The Credo start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables Marina to get a loan of $800 for purchasing a stock of clothes. She will purchase the clothes from wholesalers and then resell the clothes to customers at a higher price. This business will increase the income of her family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothes.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is a 44-year-old married woman. She has successfully built her carpet manufacturing business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva loans. She has become famous in her town for providing good-quality handmade carpets in different colors and designs. To improve her business, Munira contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Abdulai F.

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Abdulai F.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 9, 6, 4, and 2 years. Two of his children are going to school. 

In 2007, Abdulai established his business, selling clothing and accessories such as jeans, crepes (sneakers), boots, traveling boxes (luggage), school bags, and shirts. He began his business after dropping out of school due to a lack of financial support. He decided to assist with his elder brother's business for some years, and he used his commissions to start his own business.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 790,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to purchase traveling boxes, school bags, jeans, and shoes. 

In the future, Abdulai plans to buy a piece of land, provide a quality education for his children, and become an international businessman. This loan will help him to generate more income.  Inadequate capital is his main problem.  He is a hardworking businessman who thanks you for providing financial support for his business.

loans.use: to purchase traveling boxes, school bags, jeans, and shoes.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village in the Gardabani district with her husband. Naira and her husband are currently unemployed. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  Naira has decided to start her own business with a loan. However, because local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers, her credit requests were rejected several times. 

Naira did receive credit through the Credo startup loan program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This program gives rural poor people the chance to start or restart businesses.  With the loan of 600 GEL, Naira will purchase seeds for greens. She has a plot of agricultural land, where she will sow the seeds and then sell the harvest. This loan will be a great support for her family as their income will be significantly increased. 

Naira thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for greens.

loans.name: Yader José

texts.es:
Yader José  vive en  una comarca al sur de la capital trabaja  como bodeguero en una empresa  del estado. Casado con dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.
Yader  está solicitando un crédito para  invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra para  hacer un sumideros en su casa de habitación ya que en la zona donde vive carensen de servicios de agua de alcantarillado.
 Y en estos momentos es una de sus prioridades principales.
  Agradeciendo mucho por ese financiamiento que kiva le pueda dar para concretar este proyecto que es de suma necesidad para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Yader José lives in a region south of the capital. He works as a grocer in a state business. He is married with two small, school-aged children.

Yader is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials and to pay for labor to build a well in his home since in the area where he lives there is a lack of sewage water services. Right now, this is one of his main priorities.

He is very thankful for this funding that Kiva is able to give him to be able to complete this project, which is of the utmost necessity for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz, 42, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store for the past nine years. She offers a variety of products for daily use and has a good client base. 

To avoid shortages and meet customer demand, Mumtaz needs to have various goods in stock. She has requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar and juice. 

With the additional stock, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar and juice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for kids and adults.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 45-year-old mother of 2 children. To help her husband in covering their family’s increasing needs, she has a small shop where she sells toys and perfumes. She is a hard worker with 4 years of experience in her domain.

Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her stocks of toys and perfumes with newly released items and special offers that she is sure will help her to better serve her customers and provide them with special discounts. 

She hopes to keep expanding her business and increasing her loyal customers because she believes that they are her business's main capital.

loans.use: To purchase special and newly released perfumes and gifts

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Memunatu. She is married and has 4 children, aged 23, 18, 16 and 8 years. All of her children attend school. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered. 

In 1998, Memunatu established her business, selling food as well as used shoes. She was introduced to the business by her mother. When she was old enough, her mother gave her some money to start her own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, Memunatu earns about SLL 950,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy bags of groundnuts, onions, and beans and containers of vegetable oil. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to open a shop, educate her children, and buy a piece of land.  This loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. She is a hardworking and honest businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts, onions, and beans and containers of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 26-year-old unmarried lady. She is very talented and excels in making envelopes. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them in the local market. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper with some packs of glue to increase her sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper with some packs of glue.

loans.name: Seth's Group

texts.en:
Seth is the featured borrower of this Group; he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana, and has always been neighbors and friends with the other group members.

Seth has been shooting photograph for ten years, with a special expertise in video photography too. He is a 38-year-old married father of one. He has very good experience in his domain; that's why he is requesting a loan amount of 500 GHS from Kiva partner ID-Ghana to buy a printing machine, which he will use to print his customers' photos and develop his business. It will improve both his business and family situation.

Seth is standing in the middle of the photograph with Grace on his right and Elizabeth on his left, both are into the sale of household appliances and provisions respectively. They need a total amount of GHS 3,000 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a printing machine to print photos.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy pineapple-producing region. She has two children and has been in agriculture for seven years. Her primary income sources are tea, crops and personal business.

For Gladys, what is most enjoyable about farming is "feeding her livestock." Her biggest challenge is "milking." Animals on the farm have been given the name "Meni."

Gladys chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it offers "low interest." During Juhudi's required microfinance training session, Gladys learned that group members "guarantee each other."

Gladys's highest monthly expenses are her farming costs. This loan will benefit her family, because the additional income it provides will help her educate her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gladys owns a cow, poultry, pump and a bicycle but does not own a pig, motorcycle or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. In her household, Gladys has a mosquito net, solar power, a TV and DVD player but does not have electricity, running water or a sewing machine.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Kanwal

texts.en:
Kanwal is a 21-year-old vigorous, married woman. 

She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years.  She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Zainab.  She is single, and has 4 children aged 18, 15, 13 and 10 years old; all are school going children. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her as a foster child.  In 2003, Zainab established her dried fish business. She began her business after her foster parents introduced her to it, and her foster mother gave her some money to start a business on her own.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 680,000 SLL every month. 

Now Zainab is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 SLL so that she can buy baskets of dried fish. In the future, Zainab plans to expand the business, educate her children, and buy a piece of land.  The loan will help her improve her business. She thanks you for providing additional capital for her business and for your support.

loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish.

loans.name: Jemelatu

texts.en: This is 22-year-old Jemelatu.  She is married, and has 1 child aged 2 years old. In 2008, Jemelatu established her business selling nappies, rappers, bedspreads, knickers, under vests, towels, powder, Vaseline, etc.  She began her business because she used to assist her father in his business after school. When she finished secondary school there was no support to further her education. After she got married, her husband gave her some money to start her business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 678,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. to buy towels, rappers, nappies, Vaseline, powder, and under vests. In the future, Jemelatu plans to expand the business, send her son to school, and start to travel to neighboring countries to do business. Inadequate capital is her main challenge.  She is a hardworking business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy towels, rappers, nappies, Vaseline, powder, and under vests.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 27-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of availability of funds, however, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been involved in a business of plastic bags sales with her son for the past eight years. She buys used plastic bags from the market and after properly cleaning them, sells them in her locality. Through her business she makes a enough amount of income to contribute to the family. 

Perveen has four children; one of them is school-going. She is liable to provide them with good food, health and education, so she needs to earn more income to support her family well. Recently, she requested a loan worth PKR 25,000 to purchase more bags of good quality in different sizes. It will help her to inflate her sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She dreams to provide all her children with good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of good quality in different sizes.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 47-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  Razia has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her business and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb, 24, lives with his sister and parents in a small village in the Gurjaani district of Georgia. 

Ioseb is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where maize and peach trees are grown. The harvested products are sold locally. 

Ioseb has decided to start his own trade business and has requested a loan. Credo's startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, enables him to get a loan of 1,600 Georgian laris to purchase a stock of vegetables to sell. 

This investment will enable him to increase his family's income. With the increased income, he will be able to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to trade in vegetables

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, age 48, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  

She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Foday.  He is married, and has 2 children. One of his children is 5 years old and he has an 11 month old baby. The elder is in school. In 2006, Foday established his soft drink and provisions business. He began his business because he was brought up by his grandfather who was a trader.  He was in primary school when war broke out and financial problems prevented him from continuing his studies.  With the help of his grandfather he was able to learn a skilled job and trained in business.  He later set up his own business and has developed it over the years.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 594,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to purchase crates of soft drinks. In the future, Foday plans to expand his business and educate his children. The loan will help because it provides additional income.  Changes in prices of goods are  Foday's main challenge.  Foday is a very hardworking business man.  The loan will help him buy more stock in order to gain a competitive advantage.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 36-year-old woman. She has five children; four of them are school going.  

Farzana dreams to provide her children with a good quality education. She has expertise in hand embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over two years now. Initially she barely made enough money to purchase the required material, but now she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

Farzana has requested a loan worth PKR 30,000 to purchase packs of the latest beads and pearls with some spools of threads in various colors. The customers' needs are increasing with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Farzana has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase packs of latest beads and pearls with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. He has two children and has been farming for five years. His primary income sources are milk, crops and personal business.

What is most enjoyable about farming for Dickson is "watering plants." His biggest challenge is "harvesting." Animals on the farm have been given no names. 

Dickson chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of its "low interest."  During Juhudi's required microfinance training session, he learned that group members "guarantee each other."

His highest monthly expenses are farming costs. This loan will benefit his family, because the increased income will improve their stardard of living.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Among his assets are a cow, pump and bicycle but not a pig, poultry, motorcycle or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. In his household, Dickson has a mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine, TV and DVD player but not electricity or running water.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits and processes bill payments. Siti lives in Bandung semi-urban area, about 3 hours from Jakarta.  Siti is married and has two children.

Siti began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income and grow her business by selling mobile airtime and serving bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last  month, she has had around $ 10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan from KIVA  to get a printer to support her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Aminata B.

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Aminata B.  She is married and has 4 children aged 14, 9, and 7 years old along with a 1 month old baby. 3 of her children are in school. In 2013, Aminata B. established her business selling provisions including milk, sugar, mayonnaise, coffee, tea leaf, butter, etc. She started her business because her mother could not pay her school fees after her father died. She and her two sisters had to drop out of school giving their only brother the chance to continue his education.  She began helping at her mother's business to sustain the household and pay her brother's school fees.  Working 7 days a week for 12 hours a day, she earns about 505,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to purchase cartons and dozens of assorted provisions. In the future, Aminata B. plans to develop her business and improve her family’s status. Competition is her largest challenge and her business requires large amounts of capital.  Aminata is very competitive and hardworking. She thanks ARD for giving her the opportunity to acquire a loan and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons and dozens of assorted provisions.

loans.name: Rosmaida

texts.en:
Rosmaida runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. Rosmaida lives in Bandung semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Rosmaida is married.

Rosmaida began working with Ruma two months ago because she wants to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and serving bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last two  months, she has around $ 5 - 10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan from Kiva to get a printer to support her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem, 53, lives in Lahore with her husband and six children.
 
Naseem has grown old and does not have enough power to manage her household activities. She wants to do the marriage of her son so that her daughter-in-law could hold all the household activities. Her son has been running a barber shop for many years. He wants to buy new instruments and furniture but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments.
 
Due to his low purchasing power, Naseem requested a loan to empower her son so he could easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair. Naseem hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some savings for household expenses. 
Naseem say thanks to Kiva and to it field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scissors, combs, a shaving machine, gel, a mirror and a revolving chair for the barber shop.

loans.name: Ermira

texts.en:
Ermira is a 39-year-old Egyptian lady from northwestern Albania, a little coastal town overpopulated during the summer time, and she does fishing. She has three children who attend school regularly, the oldest is 14 and the youngest is 9.
  
Here is what Ermira says, laughing: “Usually you find men doing fishing, but in our case it’s me who does it and I enjoy every piece of it, too. It gives me independence and also makes me proud of myself because I bring an income home. I do it all, fishing and selling the fish afterwards and I have been operating this little activity for the past 12 years.”

Ermira, whose name in Albanian means “good smell,” is requesting a loan for the first time to buy fishnets.

loans.use: to repair the fishing nets.

loans.name: Nurhan

texts.en:
Nurhan  earns  her  living  by  rolling  tobacco  at  home. She  has  been  doing  this  job  for  two  years, working  day  and  night. She  has  applied  for  the  loan  to  buy  a  machine  to  roll  tobacco,  since she  has  been  experiencing  problems  with  her  arm. She  thinks  she  will  be  able  to  work  faster  and  make  more  money  with  the  help  of  the  machine.

Nurhan  is  married  with  four  children. Her  husband is  a  truck  driver,  and  he  is  out  of  town  most  of  the  time. The  eldest  child  is  21  years  old and  the  youngest  is  9  years  old. They  are  all  going  to  school. Nurhan  thinks  she  has  to  make  more money  to  provide  for  her  children's  school  expenses. She  has  to  work  faster  for  this  reason. Her  aim  is  to  raise  her  children  without  depending  on  anybody  and  have  a  happy  family. 

Nurhan,  who has  a  cheerful  personality,  wishes  to  provide  a  happy  future  for  her  children. She  says  that  she  always  smiles  and  never  gives  up  on  her  dreams. 

Translated  from  Turkish  by  Maya  Staff
Nurhan  Hanım,evde  tütün  sararak  gelir  elde  ediyor.İki  yıldır  gece  gündüz  bu  işi  yapan  Nurhan Hanım  kolunda  yaşadığı  problem  nedeniyle  tütün  sarma  makinesi  almak  istediği  için  krediye başvurmuş.Makineyle  daha  hızlı  çalışacağını  ve  daha  cok  gelir  elde  edeceğini  düşünüyor.Dört  çocuk annesi  olan  Nurhan  Hanımın  eşi  tır  şöförü  ve  çoğunlukla  şehir  dışında.Çocuklarından  en  büyüğü  21 en  küçüğü  9  yaşında  ve  hepsi  okula  gidiyor.Çocukların  eğitim  masrafları  için  daha  cok  kazanması gerektiğini  bu  nedenle  daha  hızlı  çalışmasının  zorunlu  oldugunu  söylüyor.Hedefi  çocuklarını  kimseye muhtaç  olmadan  büyütmek  ve  mutlu  bir  aile  olmak.Çocuklarına  mutlu  bir  hayat  vermek  isteyen  Nurhan  Hanımın  neşeli  kişiliği  hemen  dikkat  çekiyor.Hayata  gülümsediğini  ve  hayal  kurmaktan  hiç vazgeçmediğini  söylüyor.

loans.use: to buy a machine to roll tobacco

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Peace and Unity” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 3,400,000 SLL for the entire team.  With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 
Haja is the featured leader of this group.  The 30-year-old is married to a miner and they have 4 children.  Haja has been a businesswoman for 7 years now, she sells cloth/clothes and has been running this business for 7 years.  With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of cloth/clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of cloth/clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Alima.  She is married and has one child aged 7 years old and school-going. In 2008, Alima established her skirt, jeans, stretch tops, tights, middi-dresses, etc. business. She began her business because she was not privileged to attend school because her father set no value on girl child education; she was only introduced to farming.  She later ran away from her father and somebody picked her up.  The money the person usually gave her for breakfast was accumulated and was used to start this business. 

 Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000. Alima requires a loan in order to buy shirts, jeans, middi-dresses and stretch tops. In the future, Alima plans to complete her house, educate her child and acquire a shop.  This loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans.  She is a hardworking and honest businesswoman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, middi-dresses and stretch tops.

loans.name: Lucine

texts.en:
Lucine is a 49-year-old widowed mother of two children. She has a convenience store where she has sold sweets, canned food, bread, cereals, drinking water and beverages for five years. She is her family’s sole breadwinner since her husband passed away. So she has to work hard to make sure that she is capable of covering her family’s needs and developing her business at the same time. 

Lucine is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's education fees to make sure that they will have the best education. She is working hard to provide for them. She hopes to stay in good health and capable of supporting both her family and business in such a way that she can secure a better future.

loans.use: to pay her children's education fees

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Adama.  She is widowed and has four children aged 20, 18, 7 and one year old; two are school-going children. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to assist in her business.  

In 2003, Adama established her nappies, wrappers, bedspreads, undervests, socks, braces, etc. business. She began her business because she used to assist her mother in business. After she got married, her father together with her husband gave her some amount of money to start a business.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 665,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Adama requires a loan in order to buy nappies, wrappers, bedspreads, underwear, and powder. In the future, Adama plans to build another house, provide quality education for her children and open a shop.  This loan will help her to increase her stock and maximize her profit. She is a hardworking and honest businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy nappies, wrappers, bedspreads, underwear, and powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different types of electronics items.

loans.name: Foday S.

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Foday S.  He is single, and has 2 children aged 6 and 4 years, one is a school going child.  He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him to assist in business.  In 2010, Foday S. established his engine oil, battery, headlight, inner tire, clutch, piston, ring, etc. business.  He began his business because he dropped out of school due to lack of support.  One of his family members gave him a loan to start business.  After repaying the loan the profit he earned was used to continue the business to this point.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 980,000 SLL every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL.  Foday S. requires a loan in order to buy motor bike batteries, inner tires, hubs, sprockets and plugs.  In the future, Foday S. plans to develop his piece of land, open another outlet and educate his children.  This loan will help to increase stock and maximize profit.  Inadequate capital is his main problem.  He is a hardworking business man and thanks you for providing additional capital for his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy motor bike batteries, inner tires, hubs, sprockets and plugs.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Isata.  She is married and has 3 children aged 9, 5 and 3. She has 1 additional dependent who stays with her for schooling.

In 2007, Isata established her plastic pan and dishes business. She began her business just to enhance her independence. Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of plastic dishes for 1,500,000 SLL and dozens of pan dishes for 1,500,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, Isata plans to rent a larger shop and to educate her children She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic dishes

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Heri runs a small stall where he sells groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits, and also processes bill payments. He lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Heri is married and has one child.

Heri began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business. For the last  month, he has had around $10 to $15 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took out a loan from Kiva to get a printer to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer so he can process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Jenneh.  She is married and has 5 children aged 23, 21,18,15 and 12. She has 1 additional dependent: her old mum staying with her for proper care.

In 2002, Jenneh established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to support her children's education. Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Jenneh has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy waxed cotton for 3,000,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will increase her additional income. In the future, Jenneh plans to complete the construction of her house and to educate her children. She is saying thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a textile business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 41-year-old man. He lives with his wife and two children in the Khelvachauri district. His son works as a programmer and earns 200 gel per month. Murad runs a bakery and bakes Georgian bread to sell. Murad needs to purchase a stock of ingredients and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $1500 for purchasing this stock. As the stock of ingredients is purchased, he will bake more bread to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of ingredients for his bakery

loans.name: Maraiama

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has 4 children aged 24, 21, 17 and 14. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her and assists her in taking care of her business.

In 2002, Mariama established her business selling shoes, traveling boxes (luggage), clothing and textiles. She began her business just to assist her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 420,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mariama has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of ladies shoes for 1,000,000 SLL and traveling boxes for 2,000,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will increase her income level. In the future, Mariama plans to educate her children, to build a house and to further increase her stock level. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, travelling boxes, clothing and textiles for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 25-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She has been in the business of beauty parlor for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over the time, she has attained a regular list of customers, and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business, and confident that her business will move toward positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair and skin care products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 47 years old. She is a mother of four children. She has been running a boutique business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used for renovating the house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 30 años de edad, está casada con Marcos y tiene 04  hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Flor se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas, haciéndolas helar al gusto de sus clientes, para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora que compró con su ahorros y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial, sabiendo que con ese trato se ganara la preferencia de sus clientes. 
Se inició hace más de 06 años con un préstamo particular, que le sirvió para realizar sus primeras compras, viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio y con las ganancias que le dejaba los reinvirtió logrando comprar en mayores cantidades, y hasta el momento lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Antes de empezar con su negocio, nos comenta que no tenía problemas, pero si el deseo de contar con una ocupación que la distrajera, además de contar con sus propios ingresos, para así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos y no depender totalmente de él. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y está agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más segura para avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
