Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará sillas y mesas para su venta de bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Flor is 30 years old, married to Marcos and has four children, with whom she lives in her own home. Flor sells soft drinks of various flavors and brands, selling them cold to please her customers. She has a fridge that she bought with her savings to do this, which is installed in her house. She serves them in a warm and friendly manner knowing that this treatment will win her the loyalty of her customers. 

Flor started six years ago with a private loan, which helped her make her initial purchases. Seeing how welcome her business was, she re-invested the profits buying in greater quantity. She has had the help of her husband up to now. Flor comments that before opening her business, she had no problems but wanted to have an occupation to pass the time. Also she wanted to have her own income to help her husband with the expenses and not to be totally dependent on him.

This is Flor's fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful to be able to count on this financial assistance. It makes her feel more secure that she can improve her business. She promises to pay her installments on time. She will use the 1500 PEN to buy tables and chairs for her soft drinks sales.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, flour, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 43 years old and married.  She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a small tailoring shop where he sews pants, shirts, trousers, and t-shirts. He has been sewing the garments for many years, but he  doesn't have an over-lock machine for stitching and sewing. He has used the services of over-locking the clothes from the outside and paid much money against these services. 

Now he wants to have an over-lock machine of his own, but he does not have the money to purchase the machine.  Rabia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so that her husband would be able to buy over-lock machine and can save enough money.

Rabia is in her sixth loan cycle, and she has shown an excellent repayment behavior. 

Rabia is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine for her husband's garment shop.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer casada de 34  años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos el primero de 15 años, el segundo de 12 años, el tercero de 8 años y cuarto de 3 años de edad, ambos aún se encuentran estudiando y viven en el Municipio de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha junto a su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado a un costado de su vivienda. 
Ella empezó esta actividad desde hace 14 años ya que en su comunidad no había ni una tienda cercana,  es por ello que tomo la decisión de emprender este negocio que le ha ayuda a contribuir en la economía de su familia a través de sus ingresos y ganancias que obtiene a través de lo que realiza.
Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario, solo de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ganancias y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mejores oportunidades y sean unos profesionales de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Cristina is 34 years old, married, and has four school-going children aged 15, 12, 8 and 3. They live in the municipality of Santo Tomas La Unión.

Cristina is a hardworking woman. She and her husband do the best they can to help their family get ahead. Currently she runs a corner store out of one part of her house, a business she started fourteen years ago as there was no store in the community. The income and profits have enabled her contribute to household finances.

Now Cristina is seeking a loan of Q 3,000.00 to buy daily supplies so she can earn more money and offer better service to her customers.

Her dream is to help her children get a good education so they have better opportunities and can get good jobs that contribute to society.

loans.use: buy groceries

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Estela tiene 24 años, casada con  2 hijos que son de las edades una  de 7 años y la otra de 2 años.   Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como ser: uniformes para cocineros, meseros, etc. Su taller se encuentra en la zona de  Cupilupaca Norte,  este préstamo es el Primero que ha tomado de Emprender, la Sra. Estela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina Enligadora la cual cuesta Bs 10000 y cuenta con la contraparte para su negocio. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta del capital completo, la Sra.  Estela  va a utilizar los beneficios en compra de tela por rollo, la cual le permitirá mejorar su producción y de igual manera realizar los trabajos en el menor tiempo posible su deseo para  su negocio es Ampliarlo  poder abarcar mas posición en el mercado, de igual manera su mayor anhelo es hacer operar a su esposo debido a que tiene una lesión en una de sus piernas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Estela is 24 years old, married, and has two children, aged seven and two years old each.. Estela makes a living producing clothes, such as uniforms for cooks and waiters.  She has a workshop in the Cupilupaca Norte area.  This is Estela's first loan with "Emprender" and she will use it to buy a special sewing machine, which costs 10,000 Bob.  Estela already has some of the money to pay for the machine but she is applying for a loan as she does not have the full amount.  Estela will use her profits to buy rolls of material, which will allow her to improve production and to work better and in the shortest amount of time.  Estela's wish for her business is to expand it and take in a larger share of the market.  However, Estela's biggest desire is to pay for an operation for her husband, who has a lesion in one of his legs.  With this operation his quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy a special sewing machine.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 55 años, casado con 4 hijos que son ya mayores de edad, el se dedica a la  distribución de material de construcción tiene su deposito que se encuentran en la zona Villa Fátima,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Mario va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción al por mayor y así incrementar de capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por el pedido que tiene necesita de mas capital para poder abastecer sus pedidos. El Sr. Mario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son con la competencia que tiene el señor necesita tener buenos precios y bajar un poco de sus precios de venta para poder tener clientes y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material de construcción con este podrá abarcar a pedidos que necesita mayor capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le dan para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Mario is 55 years old, marred, and has four children, who are now adults.  Mario makes a living selling building material and has a shop in the Villa Fátima area.  This will be Mario's first loan with the communal bank and he will use it to buy building material in bulk and so increase his working capital.  Mario opted to apply for this loan because of the orders he has, and he needs more stock in order to be able to fulfill them.  Mario is facing challenges in his business, such as competition.  As a result Mario has to offer his products at good prices and reduce them a little in order to have customers.  Mario will use his profits in order to continue buying building materials and with this he will be able to take on more orders where he needs more working capital.  Mario is happy and grateful for this loan which will improve his business.

loans.use: to buy building material in bulk.

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es: Gustavo, a sus 52 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 15 años y vive con su pareja en unión libre. Durante su vida productiva laboró en una empresa de producción de gaseosas, pero, en el año 2002 decidió independizarse y montar una distribuidora de gaseosas, aprovechando toda la experiencia y el conocimiento que había adquirido en su anterior empleo. Cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador y abre todos los días; esta idea de negocio surgió de la necesidad de adquirir mejores recursos económicos para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, jugos, té helado) lo que le permitirá reducir los costos del producto y así aumentar el margen de ganancias por cada venta, mejorando los ingresos para su familia, con los que podrá seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida y que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria y pueda ser un hombre de bien, con buenos principios inculcados desde su hogar.
texts.en: At 52 years old, Gustavo is the father of a 15-year-old son, and he lives with his common-law partner. During his working life he worked at a soft drink production company, but in 2002 he decided to become independent and open a soft drink distributorship, taking advantage of all the experience and knowledge that he had acquired in his previous employment. He has the support of one worker and he is open every day. This business idea arose from the need for better economic resources to cover his family's basic expenses. Currently, he is asking for a loan as support to buy wholesale merchandise (soft drinks, juices, iced tea), which will allow him to reduce his product costs and thus increase his profit margin on each sale, improving his family's income. With that income, he will be able to continue moving forward in order to realize the dream that his family will have better living conditions and that his son will have the opportunity to go to college and be a respectable man with good principles instilled in his home.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (soft drinks, juices, iced tea)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new machines and renew the beauty shop

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una señora casada de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y esposo en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora que día a día lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de banano en el mercado local de su comunidad. Eligio este tipo de negocio porque su padre le enseño desde pequeña esta actividad, que hasta el momento ha sido bastante productiva ya que ha podido contribuir con el sustento familiar.
Ella ha observado que los ingresos y ganancias que le genera su negocio son aceptables, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de bananos por mayor, por lo que de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ganancias y ofrecerles un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener una casa más grande porque en la que actualmente vive es muy pequeña y se encuentra bastante deteriorada, por lo que a través de sus ganancias  podrá lograr este sueño que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Eva is 27 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and son in the Sololá department.

Eva is an enterprising woman who, every day, fights for her family's well-being.  Eva currently makes a living selling bananas in the local market.  She chose to do this kind of work as her father taught her the trade from a young age.  So far the business has been fruitful and Eva has been able to help support the family.

Eva has identified that she her business generates acceptable profits and incomes.  So, she has decided to apply for a loan of 8000 Qetzal in order to buy bananas in bulk.  With this loan Eva can increase her profits and offer good service to her customers.

Eva's dream is to have a bigger house as where she currently lives is very small and the building has deteriorated.  Through her profits Eva will be able to achieve this great dream of hers.

loans.use: to buy bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is from Goris town, where she lives together with her mother and sister. 

She has been involved in retail business for many years. In particular Armida sells cloth and dressmaking supplies to locals from her house. Armida's mother is 71 years old and is retired with a retirement pension. Armida is the only breadwinner of the family, so the income from her retail business is very important. 

For purchasing new stocks of clothing supplies, Armida has no financial resources. It is very difficult for her to save money, because the family's daily costs are rising day by day.

So by applying for this loan, Armida is asking for money to be able to purchase new stock of clothing and dressmaking supplies and sell it to her customers.

Armida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is very important for Armida to be able to continue her business and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en:
Ali is a young, hard working Iraqi man from the south part of the country, an area still considered a conflict zone. He is 19 years old, single, and lives with his family. He started work young to help support his family and contribute to their financial needs.

He now has 3 years of experience with a small business selling fruits and vegetables. To cut the transportation costs he needs to pay others, he would like to buy his own vehicle; a motorcycle-wagon, which is a 3-wheeled vehicle with a large flatbed on the back that allows for the transportation of heavy goods, boxes.

To be able to pay for the purchase, he is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, and hopes to see higher profits generated after the cut of third party involvement in his activities.    

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy his own vehicle to cut transportation costs and be able to transport goods himself.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is divorced and has 8 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Adjoa is a successful businesswoman. She sells cooked food in a chop bar in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 20 years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adjoa uses her income to provide for the entire family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava to prepare more food, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava to prepare more food, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Alex is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling charcoal in Twa  (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. 

Alex is married and has 6 children. His wife is a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Alex wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Alex plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels charcoal

loans.name: Nawal 1 Group

texts.en:
Nawal is the featured borrower of Nawal1’s group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. Their acquired loan is expected to improve their living and to expand their business.

Nawal is a 63-year-old married mother of six children.  She works in preparing and selling "mouneh" (which is based on conserving current season fruits and vegetables to be consumed during other seasons).  She has ten years of experience in this domain, with an excellent reputation.  She is recommended by almost all of her customers, because of her quality of products served.

Her acquired loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua will be invested in opening a convenience store, where she will expand her working sector and display her products in a well managed way to be attracting enough for new customers.

She hopes to stay capable of financially supporting her husband in their living, since his very low income business (taxi driver) isn’t encouraging for a family to depend on. 

Nawal is the lady covering her face with the white veil. Sarah is at the center of the picture, and Tharwa is the lady with the black spotted top.

loans.use: to open a convenience store.

loans.name: Lourdes Eulalia

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Decidió emprender en esta actividad debido a que su principal actividad era elaborar pan y también porque en su sector nadie comercializaba.  Labora todos los días amasando la harina con la ayuda de su cónyuge.  Es casada y su esposo se dedica a la pesca y además es albañil profesional.  Desea en un futuro arreglar su casa y mejorar sus ingresos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de harina y otros insumos de panadería.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Libertad.  She decided to undertake this business because her main business activity was making bread and because no one was selling in her area.

She works every day kneading the dough with the help of her husband.  She is married, and her husband is a fisherman.  He is also a bricklayer.

In the future she wishes to fix her house and improve her income.  

She now needs the loan to buy flour and other bakery supplies.

loans.use: to buy flour and other bakery supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more young animals [cattle] to raise for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renew and renovate the beauty shop

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 21 years old. She sells various items in her boutique and has been in the business for one year. 

She has requested the loan to buy more cooking oil, sugar, and jugs for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and jugs for resale.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is age 32. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 4. They both go to school. With this loan, she would like to buy more eggs, biscuits, and bread for her store. The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorbike to earn more income. In the future, she plans to have a better store.

loans.use: To buy more eggs, biscuits and bread for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas, plantains, groundnuts, yams, beans, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a 21-year-old Iraqi woman living in the southern part of the country, an area still considered a conflict zone. She is married and a mother of two children. 

With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.  She has five years experience with the home-based sewing business activity and has been making dresses for women and children based on orders from her customers. With her share of the group loan amount she will buy a new sewing machine which will allow her to work faster and produce high quality work for more customers. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more young cattle to raise

loans.name: Hayder's Group

texts.en:
Hayder is a 41-year-old Iraqi man living in the southern part of the country, an area still considered a conflict zone. He is married and a father of six children. He is the owner of a shop selling electrical appliances and electronic repair goods – an important store for an area where the irregular power supply leads to many problems that need fixing.  

Hayder has ten years experience with the store and understands his market and his customers’ demands very well. To increase his capital and be able to purchase more high quality goods in demand he is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase more high quality goods

loans.name: Astra

texts.ru: Астре 61 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Астры- высшее образование, долгое время работала товароведом, в настоящий момент пенсионерка, занимается домашним хозяйством. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Астра занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Астры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 2 овцы, а также имеет 1,70 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Астра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая, а точнее Астра намерена собрать урожай картофеля с поля, с помощью рабочей силы. Для этого она наймет несколько человек, которые помогут ей собрать урожай и хочет оплатить за их труд. Доходы от кредита Астра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на приготовление приданого для дочери.
texts.en:
Astra is a 61 year old widow.  After her husband's death, she alone raised their three children in addition to running her own business.  Astra has a university education and she worked as a merchandise expert for a long time.  She is now retired but runs a business at home.  Her family's main income is Astra's animal husbandry business, which she started 23 years ago with the purchase of 10,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Astra has 2 milking cows, 1 calf, 2 sheep, as well as 1.70 HA of land where every year she grows potatoes.  Her monthly income comes to 15,000 somi (KGS).

With an aim to developing her business further, Astra applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 somi (KGS) to help her with the harvest.  More precisely, she intends to collect the harvest with hired labor.  She will hire several people who will help her collect the harvest and she wants to pay them for their work.  Astra plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd and to save for her daughter's dowry.

loans.use: to pay for work of potatoes

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from the Noramarg village of Ararat region. She lives together with her husband and their two school-aged children. 

The income of the family comes from her retail business. Gayane sells clothing and dressmaking supplies from her house. She purchases stock from the city market and sells it to her villagers. Due to Gayane's hard and tireless work, she has been able to gain loyal customers who buy clothing supplies from her.

Now this hard-working woman needs financial support to be able to purchase new stocks of clothing and dressmaking supplies and sustain her family's living.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

So, the loan is very important for Gayane, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mercy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soft drinks in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. 

Mercy is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Mercy wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soft drinks. In the long term, Mercy plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soft drinks.

loans.name: Sabaty Group Ii

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sabaty II” group. 

These ladies are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mariama is the featured leader of this group. Mariama is 47 years old and married, with two children, who are attending secondary schools. A native of Sandor, Mariama has been a businesswoman for five years. She sells rice, groundnuts, beans, etc. 

With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts, beans, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava for her Banku business.

loans.name: Kanikey

texts.ru: Каникей 60 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 7 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Каникей - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Каникей занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Каникей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каникей обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Каникей планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kanikey is a 60 year old widow.  After her husband's death, she alone raised their 7 children in addition to running her own business.  Kanikey has a secondary level education, and her family's main source of income is from her animal husbandry business, which she started 21 years ago with a purchase of 1,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Kanikey has 2 milking cows, 1 horse, and 5 sheep.  Her monthly income comes to 5,000 somi (KGS).

With an aim to developing her business further, Kanikey applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying steers.  Kanikey plans to invest the profits from her loan in increasing the size of her herd even further.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling wakye (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She usually sells her wakye in Twa, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in preparing and selling wakye for 10 years. Ama is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus, increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty wakye as a result. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest her future profits back into her business, thus, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus, increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Emmanuel is an entrepreneur. He specializes in driving in Twa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. 

Emmanuel is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Emmanuel will use the loan to buy better spare parts to maintain his vehicle in order to expand his driving business, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his business, Emmanuel plans to diversify his services.

loans.use: to buy better spare parts to maintain his vehicle in order to expand his driving business,

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her husband and two children. For the past five years, her husband has been going abroad and working there for the season. Nazik provides for her family by selling different types of fruits and vegetables locally. Near the house where they live, Nazik sells her products and gathers income for her family. As an Armenian hardworking woman and mother of two children, Nazik does her best to be able to cover her family's daily basic needs.  

Currently, Nazik is asking for a loan to purchase a new stock of supplies to sell to customers and be able to continue her business. 

Nazik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So the loan is very important for Nazik and her whole family, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of supplies to sell to customers.

loans.name: Modestor

texts.en:
Modestor lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya and the variety of flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. Kakamega County has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Modestor is married and has two children. Both she and her husband farm. Modestor also runs a small business. She is a relatively new farmer, having only farmed for about two years.  She currently grows vegetables, beans, bananas and sweet potatoes on her land. Modestor is excited to become a beekeeper because “my kids will use the honey and it is good for their health and the income is good.”

This is Modestor’s first loan with Kiva.  She plans to use the income from her beehives to expand her business. Her hope for the future is to “buy more hives for more income, educate my children and do well in my business.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Phesto

texts.en:
Phesto lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old-growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Phesto is married, and he has twelve children. His wife is a homemaker, while Phesto farms their land. He has been farming for no fewer than 68 years, and he is currently growing sugarcane and vegetables on his land. He likes beekeeping because “there is no hard work around it,” and it still produces income.

This is Phesto’s first loan with Kiva.  He plans to use the income to “take care of my wife and I, as we are old.” 

Phesto’s hope for the future is “for my children to live a good life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Rosemary is widowed and has six children. She has been farming for forty five years, and is currently growing maize, vegetables and sugarcane on her land. She is excited to become a beekeeper because, as she says, “I love honey as medicine.”

This is Rosemary’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to invest the income from her hives into her farming activities. When asked about her hopes for the future, Rosemary replied “I don’t want to be poor.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Nurzina

texts.ru: Нурзине 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Нурзины- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурзина занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, а также имеет 3,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурзина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая, а точнее Нурзина намерена собрать урожай фасоля с поля, с помощью рабочей силы. Для этого она наймет несколько человек, которые помогут ей собрать урожай и хочет оплатить за их труд. Доходы от кредита Нурзина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurzina is 38 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising 5 children.  Nurzina has a secondary level education and her family's main source of income is her animal husbandry business, which she started 15 years ago with the purchase of 6,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Nurzina has 2 milking cows, 10 sheep, and 3.0 HA of land where every year she grows beans.  Her monthly income comes to 15,000 somi (KGS).  

With an aim to developing her business further, Nurzina applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 somi (KGS), which she will use to collect her harvest.  More precisely, she intends to collect the harvest with the help of hired labor.  She will hire several people who will help her collect the harvest and she wants to pay them for their work.  Nurzina plans in invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her herd and to save up some money for repairing their home.

loans.use: to hire laborers for the harvest

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Stephen is married, and has twelve children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and have been farming for twenty-five years. They are currently practicing mixed farming: they raise goats, sheep and poultry, and grow maize, vegetables and sugarcane. Stephen likes beekeeping because “it generates income, and honey is medicinal.”

This is Stephen’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to invest the income from his hives into his farming. His hope for the future is to see “my children finish school and get jobs, and buy more land”.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Ann is married, and has two children. Her husband works as a businessman, while Ann farms their land. She has been farming for five years, and is currently growing vegetables, bananas and beans. She likes beekeeping because it is not an involving activity, but it still generates an income. 

This is Ann’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to educate her children. Her hope for the future is to “live a happy life with my family".

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Philip has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt, among many other items.

To help expand his business, Philip has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop such as sugar and salt to sell.  It will help Philip to generate greater profits and buy more goods to add into his business. 

Philip hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Philip is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Philip who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy many more items for his shop such as sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Aliza

texts.ru: Ализе 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Ализы- высшее образование, работает в местной школе преподавателем географии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Ализа занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ализы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,9 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ализа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ализа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Aliza is 30 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising three children.  Aliza has a university education and is a geogrpahy teacher in the local school.  As a source of additional income for her family, Aliza has an animal husbandry business, which she started 10 years ago with the purchase of 5,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Aliza has 1 milking cow, 1 calf, and 2.9 HA of land where every year she grows beans and perennial grasses.  Her monthly income comes to 5,000 somi (KGS).

With an aim to developing her business further, Aliza applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 somi (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying a cow.  Aliza plans to invest the profits from her loan in increasing the size of her herd even further and to save up money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35-year-old business man. He is married to Hannah and together they are blessed with three children. Joseph has been in the transport industry for the past five years. He has a monthly income of KES 11,130 which he uses for the upkeep of his family. 

Joseph will use the loan to service his rickshaw to better its efficiency as well as to purchase insurance coverage for the rickshaw. With the expected profit from the business, Joseph will buy a new motorbike to add to his daily income. 

Joseph's hopes and dreams are to manage his own transport company.

loans.use: to service his rickshaw and also to purchase  insurance coverage for the rickshaw.

loans.name: Kenjetay

texts.ru: Кенжетай 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Кенжетай- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кенжетай занимается животноводством, стартовав 27 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кенжетай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 кобыла, а также имеет земельный надел мерою1,20 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает перец, фасоль, капусту и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжетай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кенжетай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kenjetay is 50 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising 4 children.  Kenjetay has a secondary education and her family's main source of income is Kenjetay's animal husbandry business, which she started 27 years ago with the purchase of 1,500 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  Thanks to Kenjetay's hard work, today she has 1 milking cow, 1 mare, and 1.20 HA of land where every year she grows peppers, beans, cabbage, and clover.  Her monthly income comes to 12,000 somi (KGS).

With an aim to developing her business further, Kenjetay applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to buy cows.  Kenjetay plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd and to save up money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and three children. Tigran earns his family's living by providing taxi service. He has been involved in this business for a year, but is already very skilled and a beloved driver for locals.
 
Currently, Tigran needs financial support to purchase tires and to be able to continue providing taxi service. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Tigran and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tires for the car.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, George has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, water, bread, milk, and other items.

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop, such as sugar and salt to sell.  It will help George to generate greater profits and expand his business and pay school fees for his children. 

George hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a plot of land. 

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop, such as sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Мамуржону сейчас 54 года. Он много лет занимается продажей приправ и семян овощей (около 23 года), и продает свой товар на рынке города Турсунзаде. Мамуржон хочет увеличить оборот товара и расширить свой бизнес. Он берет повторный кредит с той же целью. На сумму от кредита он хочет закупить приправы, в частности молотый черный и красный перец, кунжут, розмарин, молотый базилик и т.д., а также семена овощей. Мамуржон будет стараться, чтоб его прилавок заполнялось новым товаром, а к месту ближе прилавке собралось много клиентов.
texts.en: Mamurjon is currently 54 years old.  For many years (about 23), he has been in the business of spices and vegetable seeds, which he sells at the market in Tursunzoda.  Mamurjon wants to increase the turnover of his inventory and expand his business.  He is taking out a new loan with that goal.  With the loan funds, he wants to buy spices, in particular black and red pepper, sesame, rosemary, and ground basil, etc.  He also wants to buy vegetable seeds.   Mamurjon will try to fill up his trading stall with new goods so that many more people will approach his counter.

loans.use: to buy spices and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 51 years old. He is the father of six children, aged between 7 and 21 years.  

With the loan, he would like to buy more cattle for sale. The profits from his business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Myriam Mercedes

texts.es: Myriam es una mujer viuda de 51 años de edad que vive con sus 4 hijos. Hace 18 años se dedica a vender mercancía de manera independiente, en un puesto pequeño ubicado en el centro de la ciudad donde reside, allí trabaja todos los días de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm, ofrece blusas, correas, jeans, entre otros, algunas prendas son elaboradas por ella misma; de esta forma genera los ingresos con los cuales ha sacado adelante a sus hijos desde que su esposo murió y además ha solventado las necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer humilde, sencilla y trabajadora, lucha incansablemente sobrepasando diversos obstáculos y adversidades, especialmente la competencia desleal que hay en el sector y los constantes cambios de la moda; por ello busca opciones que le permitan salir adelante. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (blusas, jeans, correas, medias) para abastecerse para la temporada navideña que se aproxima, así podrá ofrecer una gran variedad de mercancía a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas e ingresos familiares. Myriam sólo desea que sus 3 hijos mayores, quienes ya son profesionales puedan emplearse y así poder salir de la situación precaria por la que está atravesando su familia, además desea que en un futuro pueda disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de los suyos.
texts.en:
Myriam, 51, is a widow who lives with her four children.  She has sold merchandise independently for 18 years in a small stall located downtown in the city where she lives.  She works there from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day selling blouses, belts, jeans, and other clothing.  She makes some of the garments herself.  This is how she earns the income with which she has gotten her children ahead since her husband died.  She also has covered the basic necessities of her household.

Myriam's a modest, unassuming, and hardworking woman who strives tirelessly, overcoming various obstacles and adversities such as unfair competition in the field and constant changes in fashion.  This is why she looks for options that will let her get ahead.

She's requesting the loan to invest in buying stock wholesale (blouses, jeans, belts, socks) to supply herself for the upcoming Christmas season.  This way she'll sell her customers a wider variety of merchandise and satisfy their various desires, which will result in an increase in sales and family income.

Myriam wants only for her three older children, who are already professionals, to be able to get jobs so they can get out of the precarious situation her family is going through.  She also wants to enjoy a better quality of life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children, daughter-in-law, granddaughter and mother-in-law in the Gurjaani district, eastern Georgia. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family has a vineyard and they produce wine to sell. In addition, Elene trades clothing. She requested a loan for purchasing a horse and calves. 
The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2000 Georgian lari (GEL). With the received credit she will purchase a horse and calves. Her husband will go to the local forest and transport wood by the horse to sell in winter times. She will raise the calves and start producing dairy products. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family to increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and a dough-making machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish and smoked fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris, de 32 años de edad, está casada con Odilo y vive en compañia de sus 2 hijos, su abuelo y su esposo en su propia casa, la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo. Damaris se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas de distintas marcas y sabores. También se dedica a  la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser  y una máquina remalladora con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su hogar,  donde atiende a sus clientes, quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganarse  su aceptación y así la recomiendan con otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Se inicio hace mas de  01 año en éste negocio, realizándolo sola, pero gracias a la venta de bebidas gasificadas puede apoyar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en comprar  bebidas gasificadas al por mayor y materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones.
texts.en:
Damaris, 32, is married to Odilo and lives with her two children, her grandfather, and her husband in her own house, which she build with a lot of effort.

Damaris earns a living selling carbonated beverages in various brands and flavors.  She also makes a living sewing, which she learned in a vocational education center.  Later she bought a sewing machine and a darning machine with her savings and set them up in her house, where she serves her customers.  They always seek her out because of her good work.  She earns their approval, so they recommend her to other people who later become steady customers.

Damaris started this business more than a year ago and does it alone.  Thanks to the sale of carbonated beverages, though, she can help her husband with the household expenses.

This is Damaris's fourth Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial support she receives so she can get ahead, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

Damaris will invest the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles [PEN] in carbonated beverages wholesale and sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages and sewing supplies

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is a farmer from the village of Amberd in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and  her two-year-old grandchild. Astghik and her family are engaged in breeding hens and in cultivation of beans, cucumbers, and strawberries. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. Astghik’s husband and son help her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

Astghik currently needs a loan of $1500 to purchase some fertilizer and other materials, such as cellophane and bottles, needed for cultivation of plants and strawberries. Astghik and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support, helping them collect the needed amount of loan for developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some fertilizer and other materials, such as cellophane and bottles, needed for cultivation of plants and strawberries

loans.name: Nkanga 2 Tukore Group

texts.en: Christine, a mother of three, does small scale farming and also sells groceries. She said she ventured into this because there was high demand among the town dwellers. She thanks Ugafode for giving their group money each time they need it and is grateful that Kiva lenders are also willing to partner with them. She will use the loan to buy seeds and pesticides for the vegetables that she grows at her homestead. She is hardworking and wants to grow the project to a bigger level. She is hardworking and urges fellow women to become involved in income generating activities.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 53 años es madre de dos hijos, los cuales ya son independientes, vive en su casa propia desde donde lucha continuamente para mejorar su nivel de vida. Florinda se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir de diferentes telas. Ella ha establecido poco a poco su pequeño pero muy productivo taller en su casa en donde diseña y refacciona diferentes prendas de vestir. Cuenta que hace tiempo trabajaba con una señora que distribuía sus prendas de vestir en un conocido centro comercial de la ciudad, pero con el paso de los años se dio cuenta que ella también podría realizar sus propios diseños y es así como emprendió esta nueva etapa. Trabaja ya 10 años en este negocio y desde que empezó se ha mantenido estable. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que todos los días su dinero esta en movimiento y eso genera ingresos diarios, además de disponer de su tiempo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará telas, hilos y elásticos que usa en su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
Florinda, 53, is the mother of two children who are already independent.  She lives in her own house, where she strives continually to improve her standard of living.

Florinda earns a living making garments of different fabrics.  Little by little she has set up her small but very productive workshop in her house, where she designs and makes a variety of garments.  She says that some time ago she used to work with a woman who distributed her garments in a well-known shopping center in the city.  In time, however, Florinda realized that she could make her own designs, which is how she started on this new phase.

She has worked for 10 years in this business, which has been stable since she began.  What she likes most about her job is that her cash is flowing every day, which generates a daily income.

Currently Florinda will request 800 nuevos soles [PEN].  She's very grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead and promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy fabric, thread, and elastic, which she uses in her daily work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and elastic

loans.name: Gulsunay

texts.ru: Гулсунай 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулсунай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулсунай занимается животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсунай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также в собственности имеет 2,10 ГА поливной земли, на которой ежегодно сажает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсунай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulsunay is 49 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising 2 children.  Gulsunay has a secondary level education.  The main source of income for Gulsunay's family is her animal husbandry business, which she started 29 years ago with the purchase of 2,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of Gulsunay's hard work, today Gulsunay has one milking cow and 2.1 HA of irrigated land where every year she grows beans and clover.  Her monthly income comes to 12,000 somi (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulsunay applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying cattle.  Gulsunay plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd and to save up money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Beatrice is married, and has four children. Both she and her husband have been farming for five years, and are currently growing vegetables and napier grass, an interesting grass that acts as a high-protein fodder for livestock as well as part of a pest prevention strategy by ‘pulling’ pests towards it and away from other food crops. She likes beekeeping because it is an income-generating activity that requires little hard work. 

This is Beatrice’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to buy a dairy cow. Her hope for the future is to buy land and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Livine

texts.en:
Livine is 35 years old. She is the mother of two children ages 8 and 12.  Her children both attend school. 

Livine sells various items in her boutique and has been running the boutique for the past five years. With the loan she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and other items for resale.

loans.use: To buy more boutique items for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives and works outside of Kakamega town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. The variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It also has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (nearly 600 people per square kilometer in some areas).  This may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.  

Gladys is married and has seven children and many grandchildren. Her husband works as a pastor and she farms their land. She has been farming for 23 years and is currently growing vegetables, maize and sugarcane on her land. Gladys loves eating honey on bread and is looking forward to having her own hives so that she can eat fresh honey. 

This is Gladys’ first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to “take care of [some of] my grandchildren because the parents are not around.” Gladys’ hope for the future is to “live a stress-free life and for my children to get jobs.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Alima

texts.ru: Алиме 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 2 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Алимы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алима занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Алима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Alima is 57 years old and a widow.  Since her husband's death, she alone has been raising their two children as well as running her own business.  Alima has a secondary level education and her family's main source of income is Alima's animal husbandry business, which she started 14 years ago with the purchase of 8,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Alima has 2 milking cows and 10 sheep.  Her monthly income comes to 15,000 somi (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Alima applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 somi (KGS) to buy cows for fattening and reselling at the market at a good price.  Alima plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter lives near Kakamega town in Kakamega county, located in Western Kenya. This county is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugar cane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Walter is married and has three children. Both him and his wife have been farming for six years, and are currently growing vegetables, beans and maize on her land. Walter thinks that beekeeping is a good project because it generates income from land without too much work. 

This is Walter’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to educate his children. His hope for the future is “for my children to finish school and to buy more hives for more income.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Silvanus

texts.en:
Silvanus lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in western Kenya, and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping, due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Silvanus is married, and has three children. His wife runs a small business, while Silvanus farms their land. He has been farming for 15 years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables on his land. He is looking forward to starting beekeeping, as it is a good income-generating project that allows him to make full use of his land. 

This is Silvanus’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income to pay his children’s school fees. Silvanus’ hope for the future is to “buy a car and become a successful farmer.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel lives outside of Kakamega town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas. Maize is the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Gabriel is married and has six children. He and his wife both engage in projects on their land. They are currently tending to dairy cows and growing vegetables. Gabriel is excited to become a beekeeper and he says “I love farming and I want to try beekeeping.”

This is Gabriel’s first loan with Kiva and he plans to use the income to pay his children’s school fees. His hope for the future is to “build a nice house.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Salihe

texts.en:
Salihe is a 51-year-old Roma woman who has been selling second-hand clothing at the Roma market for the past ten years. She lives in a major city in the central Albania, and is the only one in the family to bring an income home.The market where she sells is the biggest in Albania, and the most popular. 

Every Roma who uses this market has pitched in money to build their booth; they also shared expenses on the common areas. Some of them even live there; they have some open concept, let’s say sort of rooms, with no water, toilets, or a kitchen. It’s just some beds on the floor, and these rooms serve as fitting rooms if needed. 

The quality of clothes though is very good, because the majority of clothes are not donated, but are sold by kilos from stores from the nearby western countries. Romas are good at doing this type of activity.

Salihe wants to stock up on seasonal inventory items with this loan.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is an 18-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Khaled finished his school this year with a very good grades and he will regester in the university. Khaled would like to take the BA and maybe study for a higher degree in the future so he can find a good job and help his family in the future. Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his university study, and will help him to write reports and do his homework. Khaled appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father is a worker and this is the only source of income to the family. Ahmad is still a student in a local college where he studies science. Ahmad would like to finish his study with very high grades so he can find a good job and help his family in the future. Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study, and will help him to use specific programs to do his projects and homework. Ahmad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Saidali

texts.ru: Сайдали житель района А.Джоми, занимающийся растениеводством. Ему 27 лет. Он семьянин и отец двух детей. Сайдали имеет 0,30 га приусадебного и президентского участка земли, на котором выращивает огородные культуры. Он занимается этим с юного возраста еще когда помогал отцу и уже 15 лет как он работает на земле. За этот большой промежуток времени он приобрел огромный опыт земледелия. Параллельно он еще и занимается животноводством. Сайдали сейчас готовится к осеннему посеву. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить ГСМ, минеральные удобрения, семена картофеля, помидора и огурцов. С полученной прибыли он хочет отремонтировать свою машину, которая служит ему для перевозки урожая на рынок с целью продажи.
texts.en:
Saidali is 27 years old and lives in the A. Jomi region and is in the farming business.  He is a family man and the father of two children.  Saidali has 0.3 HA of personal and granted land where he grows garden crops.  He has been doing this since a young age when he helped his father.  He has been working on the land for 15 years.  Over this long period of time, he has gained a wealth of experience in farming.  Along with farming, he also raises cattle.  

Saidali is now getting ready for an autumn planting.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy fuel oils, mineral fertilizers, and potato, tomato, and pepper seed.  Saidali wants to use the profits he earns to overhaul the truck he uses to carry his harvest to market for sale.

loans.use: to buy fuel, fertilizer, and seed

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm oil and kernel in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Ama is married and has four children; her husband is a trader. 

The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, and paying for their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of palm oil and kernel, thus helping her improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm oil and kernel, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from the village Sarakap in the Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband, two sons, a daughter-in-law and a one-year-old grandchild. 

Aida and her family earn a living through farming which is the only source of income for them. They breed a livestock of cows, sheep and hens. Aida’s husband and sons help her get the agricultural products to the local market. Aida now wants to start cultivating wheat. The family’s agribusiness needs some investments to function in a sustainable way. 

A loan of $3000 USD will be very helpful by enabling them to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for the livestock, to purchase fuel and to pay for technical services. Aida and her family depend on the good will of the lenders and are very thankful to them for helping to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for the livestock, to purchase fuel and to pay for technical services

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is an experienced farmer from the village of Sarnakunk in the Syunik region. She lives with her husband, son and school-age daughter. Yelena's husband and son work in the private sector. However, their salaries are so low that they cannot fully meet the family's needs. 

To be able to cover the family's expenses, Yelena in engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, sheep, pigs, piglets and hens. She is also cultivating beech, potato and grass. Farming is an important source of income for the family. 

To be able to run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Yelena currently needs a loan of $2,000 USD to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to buy some forage for the livestock. Yelena and her family depend on the good will of the lenders and are grateful to them for helping to provide the loan for developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to buy some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Kashenyi Group

texts.en:
Kashenyi Tukwatanise group is located a few kilometres away from-Ibanda town council. It is comprised of mainly women who range in different categories of married, singles, divorced and widows.

Loyce is a single mother who divorced from her husband due to family problems. She is operating a grocery in a busy market and has three children. She struggles to take care of the children and other family necessities since she does all this single-handedly. She requested a loan of UGX 500,000 to help her add more stock of groceries in her business and use the rest of the money to pay rent and tuition for her children. Her major challenge is lack of a permanent place of work since she is still renting which affects her cash flow. She is a hard working lady striving hard to provide a good future for her children.

.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell more pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and beans, which will help in improving her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare more food, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Shabaan

texts.en: Shabaan is an 18-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father is a worker and this is the only source of income to the family. Shabaan is a student in his first year in a local collage where he studies human science. Shabaan would like to finish his study with very high grades so he can find a good job and help his family in the future. Shabaan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study, and will help him to do his projects and homework. Shabaan appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.ru: Норбиби 46 лет. Она живет с семьей в городе Турсунзаде. Но большую часть времени она проводит на дороге.  Норбиби занимается продажей тканей и материалов для шитья одежды. Она закупает свой товар с города Душанбе и перепродает их в отдаленных деревнях и селах в таких районах, как Яван, Шахритус, Кубодиён, Вахш, Хуросон и до самого Памира. Норбиби такой деятельностью занимается около 20 лет. Она любит свою работу и хочет продолжить свою торговую деятельность. Норбиби просит кредит, чтобы закупить партию тканей, если она на все свои сбережения купит ткани, ей не хватит средств  на дорогу. Норбиби надеется на вашу поддержку!
texts.en:
Norbibi is 46 years old and she and her family live in the city of Tursunzoda.  However, she spends most of her time on the road.  Norbibi sells fabric and materials for sewing clothes.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Dushanbe and resells it in distant villages and rural areas like Yavan, Sharihtus, Kubodien, Vahsh, and as far way as Pamir.  Norbibi has been in this business for about 20 years.  She loves her business and hopes to extend her business activities.

Norbibi is requesting a loan to buy a shipment of fabric because if she uses all her savings for the fabric, she will have no money left for business travel.  Norbibi is relying on your support!

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед 28 летний фермер. Он начал свою земледельческую деятельность около 7 лет назад. На своей земле он занимается посевом овощей, в том числе помидоров, огурцов, лука и дополнительно сеит ячмень. Хуршед выкладывается на все сто. Он не жалеет сил и времени. Хуршед старается получить богатый урожай и продать его, чтобы прокормить семью. Ведь у него жена и маленькие дети. Его жена ухаживает за детьми, ведет домашнее хозяйство и дополнительно помогает мужу в деятельности. В данный момент Хуршед обратился за кредитом, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения. Он хочет успеть обработать посеянные овощи, чтобы в дальнейшем собрать качественный и богатый урожай.
texts.en: Khurshed is a 28-year-old farmer who began working in agriculture about seven years ago. On his land he grows vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers and onions as well as barley. Khurshed gives 100% to everything and doesn't spare his strength or time. He is trying to bring in a rich harvest and sell it in order to feed his family, as he has a wife and small children. His wife takes care of the children and the house and helps her husband in his business. At the moment Khurshed is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. He wants to succeed in growing the vegetables he has planted so that in the future he can gather a bountiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for his vegetable farm

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years. Abena is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
