Meet 30-year-old Hawa from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. In 2006, Hawa established her retail business. She did not got to school, and was trained in her business. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business is sometime she finds it difficult to move around door to door selling her food commodities.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 21 года. Она живет с родителями в городе Турсунзаде. Сайёра сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Она предоставляет услуги швеи. Почти 5 лет Сайёра шьет женские национальные платья по заказу. Для шитья одного платья уходит много времени, потому что у Сайёры старая машинка та самая, которую вы видите на фотографии. Этой машинке около 30 лет и даже больше. Ее родители сами не помнят, когда ее покупали. Сайёра нуждается в новой, современной швейной машинке, но не может приобрести из-за нехватки финансов. Сайёра очень хочет новую машинку и действительно нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Sayora is an unmarried young woman of 21. She lives with her parents in the city of Tursun-zoda. Sayora earns her living by offering sewing services. For almost five years she has been sewing women's national dresses to order. Sewing one dress takes a great deal of time, because Sayora has an old sewing machine, as you can see in the photo. This machine is at least 30 years old - even her parents don't remember when they bought it. Sayora needs a new, modern sewing machine, but has been unable to get one due to a shortage of funds. She really wants a new sewing machine and is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 53-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and two sons in a humble house.  Her husband is a worker with a very low wage, and her older son also works to help his family.  Amneh would like her son to finish his degree at the university where he is a second year studying Physical Education, so Amneh took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university tuition bills for her son and help him to finish his study so he can find a good job in the future. Amneh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university bills for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is single and has 2 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Sadia is a successful businesswoman. She sells groundnuts and maize in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about a year. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Sadia uses her income to provide for the entire family. Sadia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groundnut and maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sadia plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells in order to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groundnut and maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Isatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of three and fifteen years. Two of her children are attending school. She started her business because she wants to generate income to support her needs.

Isatu runs a cookery business; she sells cooked food at home. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business eleven hours per day, seven days per week. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isatu a has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities like rice, coconut oil, cooking seasoning and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase food commodities like rice, coconut oil, cooking seasoning and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Marie from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children aged seven and twelve years.   In 2009, Marie established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family and become independent.  She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her living status and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Isatu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children aged six and seventeen years old.  In 2003, Isatu established a gardening business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income.  She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more sodium, fertilizer and seeds for her gardening business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and build her business further. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sodium, fertilizer and seeds for her garden business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ru: Жамал 51 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Жамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамал занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jamal is 51 years old, she is a widow. She is raising three children and also runs her own business after her husband's death. Jamal has secondary education and does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family which she started 22 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Jamal now has two milk cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 6,000 som. With the purpose to further grow her business Jamal has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy a calf to increase the headcount of cattle. Jamal plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and also save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Twa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Adjoa is married and has 8 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.  In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 35 years old and is from Waterloo in the area east of Freetown. She is married with 5 children. In 2008 Fatmata established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to provide for her children's welfare.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to continue to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wooden boards to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of clothes

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Fatmata from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 9 and 29 years. Ten years ago, Fatmata established her food retail business. She began her business because life was hard for her, so she decided to do business which will benefit her. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says her major hardship is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more flour, oil, ground nuts and sugar to prepare her cakes for sale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Fatmata, plans to send her children to university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, oil, ground nuts and sugar to prepare her cakes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize, gari (starch dish) and groundnut for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Sarah is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling charcoal and raw rice in Twa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Sarah is married and has 6 children. Her husband is farmer.  The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Sarah will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal and raw rice, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal and raw rice, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo.
Fatmeh is a 25-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of one son and three daughters.  Her husband (pictured) is an employee in a local company and this is the only source of income for the family.  He gets a very low wage which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.  Fatmeh and her husband would like to improve the family's living conditions but they do not have enough money for that, so Fatmeh took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. The system will provide the family with hot water using clean and cheap power which will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Although he has received no formal education, Samuel is an entrepreneur.  He is a tailor in Twa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Samuel is married and has 8 children. His wife works as a trader.  The proceeds from his business normally go toward helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Samuel will use the loan to purchase sewing materials to expand his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to further diversify the types of products that he sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour to make more bread for customers

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario leads a women's cooperative known as To'ooneel Ixoq. They specialize in handwoven accessories and hammocks and would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including string and natural dyes.  Rosario and the team have been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is their story:

"We are a group of hard-working, creative and enterprising women with a desire to improve the lives of our family and our community," says Rosario, who serves as president of the association. "Our mothers taught us to weave when we were only little girls, and they also taught us how to dye threads with natural pigments to protect our environment. In fact, that is our specialty – our weaves are done with cotton threads dyed with tree bark, leaves and fruits. We go by the name To'ooneel Ixoq, which in the Tzutujil Maya language means 'Feminine Development.' We are a very united team, and the most beautiful thing about being in this team is that we support each other, and we encourage members to create their own designs. Our dream is to one day have our own store and a community workshop, because at the moment we work from our own homes."

"I am very thankful to those who support us because it is very difficult to have enough capital this time of year to keep up with demand. With this microcredit, we will be able to invest in raw materials and continue working."

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for handwoven accessories and hammocks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste), cocoa drink and bread. She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Twa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 4 years.  Ama is married and has 10 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, she will be able to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare and sell more of her tasty gari as well as other provisions

loans.name: Igorora Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Doreen is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school.  Two dropped out due to lack of tuition.

Doreen sells roasted plantain (Gonja) by the road side. Her customers are passengers who stop over to buy something to eat. Her major challenge is harsh weather conditions like sunshine and rain, which disrupt her during her business operations since she has to sit by the road side waiting for her customers.

She runs her business with limited capital of ugx.100,000. She requested a loan of ugx.300,000 to add in her working capital so as to increase her cash flow. She will use the rest of the money to pay tuition for her children and buy them a few basic needs.
 
Despite all these challenges, Doreen is a very hard-working woman who is striving had to provide a good education and a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy plantain to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Fatmata from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is single with two children, ages 1 and 12 years old. In 2010, Fatmata established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income for her living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Modern Modern Group

texts.en:
The Modern Modern Group is located in the outskirts of Ibanda Town.  One of its members, Hellen, is a single mother who lost her husband in a fire accident in 2010. She was left with five children and she also takes care of her sister's two daughters who were abandoned by their mother. Hellen runs a small drug shop with small capital.  Besides that, she also has a small poultry farm where she gets income to boost her drug shop business.  She applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings so as to buy poultry feed for her chickens and she plans to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children and provide the basic needs in life.
Her major challenges are insufficient capital to boost her business, thieves who steal her chicken, and diseases which affect her cash flow.  Despite all of these challenges, Hellen has been able to provide a good education and basic needs for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has 4 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells porridge in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 8 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize to prepare porridge, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize to prepare porridge, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking pots to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 years old and is from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children. Margret has operated her food commodities business for more than 12 years. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that her business is currently doing well.

Margret requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Margret plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of liquid soap, rice and products, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 30 years old and is from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children who are 8 and 12 years old. Finda has been operating  her food commodities business for more than 10 years. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that she is currently facing high competition in the market.

Finda requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Finda plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and pure water for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a pick up truck, purification machines and more water bottles and racks, for distributing water to the community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of shoes and slippers, to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.en: Cristobal, a Tlaxcalan dairy farmer, is enthusiastic about using technology to improve his production. He's a pioneer and is often among the first in his community to try new practices or equipment, and he is excited about purchasing his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. Currently, his dairy cows produce significant amounts of waste he wants to better utilize. With his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will convert the abundant waste into renewable energy in the form of biogas and a potent biofertilizer, allowing him to reduce operating costs on the farm while maintaining or improving yields. This loan represents 45% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en: Heriberto and his family live pretty much entirely on what they earn from farming and are constantly looking for ways to reduce costs and improve yields. Heriberto is investing in an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to treat the abundant animal waste on-site to produce renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer. The methane-rich biogas will allow him to displace expensive, fossil-fuel based LP gas in the kitchen and bathroom and the biofertilizer will allow him to improve crop yields without having to purchase expensive agrochemical fertilizer. Concurrently, the digester will mitigate the amount of greenhouse gas generated by his animals. This loan represents 39% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her by purchase and prepare more local pastry, palm oil and coconut oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize which will help her to improve her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bread and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a member of the group called El Sol sale para Todos 3, located in a rural area of the city of Hato Mayor. This is his 6th loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has a business of selling clothes and shoes, started with his first loan in Esperanza.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Jose realized the need to improve his home structure. With this housing loan he is able to take, and with his business profits, he can pay for the home improvements and save for more. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to start with the house construction. Now he will finish building his house by adding doors and windows, and cover the concrete block with cement.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. Jose lives together with his long term partner. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy windows, doors, rods, cement and others construction material for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thereby increasing her overall sales.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 35 years old, from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is very hardworking on running her used clothing business. She is married with 1 child who is school-age. The meager income of this "ukay-ukay" business has supported the daily needs of their family.

She has previously paid her loans in a timely fashion and now she is requesting for a loan of Php 8,000 to buy additional volume of stocks - used clothing for resale. Estela hopes to open more store outlets in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing stock for resale

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Бунафша имеет умелые руки. Она шьет национальные женские одежды. Бунафша занимается этим бизнесом более 3 лет. Она имеет своих клиентов и имеет хорошую репутацию среди местного населения.  Кроме того, как Бунафша шьет национальные одежды, она учится в институте. Она учится отлично и мечтает после окончания института стать хорошим специалистом и работать в государственной учреждении. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3200 сомони для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a young and cheerful woman. She is 26 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Bunafsha has skillful hands. She sews women's national clothing. Bunafsha has worked with this business for more than three years. She has her own clients and has a great reputation among the local population. 

Apart from sewing national clothing, Bunafsha studies at the institute. She studies well and dreams of becoming a specialist, working at a state institution, after graduating from the institute. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,200 somoni to pay her tuition.

loans.use: To pay her tuition

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 54 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Basilia has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Basilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional tricycle for her business.

Basilia has been in this business for 16 years. Basilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional tricycle for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from firewood vending.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and married. Cristina works very hard to provide for her family.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc. 

Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hilma

texts.en:
Hilma is 50 years old and has five children. Hilma is married and all five children are in school.

Hilma is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. Hilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Hilma has been in this business for 14 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Hilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia’s housekeeping broker service, N&S Domestics, offering adult, child and pet care, as well as housekeeping, serves Austin and surrounding areas.

Her clients may schedule a cleaning of living areas, bedrooms and bathrooms.along with traditional sweeping and mopping, or other work as extensive as cleaning refrigerators, ovens, blinds, washing, folding and ironing, and silver and wood polishing. However, housework isn’t the only service N&S Domestics offers. 

Sylvia also offers individualized care for pets or family members.   A complete list and description of what Sylvia and her team offers are on her website: http://www.nsdomestics.com/.

“We are the first household agency in Travis and Hays County,” Sylvia says.  “Our mission is to implement the ethics of hard work into the agency policy and procedures to assist clients during screening processes.”   She adds that she carefully reviews and screens each job applicant before she assigns someone to serve a client.
 
Sylvia has an extensive amount of expertise in her field and her business continues to expand. At the beginning of September, she hired three full-time employees, bringing her total number of contractors to 13.  Sylvia knew that in order to continue growing, she would need to market her business.

After visiting the Austin Hispanic Chamber and Business Networking Inc., Sylvia was referred to Accion Texas Inc.  Her loan was used to purchase five billboards in the nearby Texas towns of Oak Hill and Kyle.

Sylvia is also on social media. Feel free to find her here: https://www.facebook.com/nsdomestics?fref=ts/ or https://twitter.com/nsdomestics/.

loans.use: to purchase five billboards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory levels and thereby sell greater quantities of food.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is widowed and has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines.

Marina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell to her customers.

Marina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 30 years old and has three children. Marissa is married and all three children are in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising livestock. Maribel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell in her business.

Maribel has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana works hard to support her family. Feliciana is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Feliciana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her tricycle.

Feliciana has been in this business for 7 years now.

Feliciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат 34 года, не замужем. У Нурзат- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода Нурзат занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурзат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurzat is 34 years old and not married. She has secondary education. As her main income, Nurzat works with livestock breeding, after having started nine years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurzat's persistent work, her farm currently consists of four dairy cows, two horses and 25 sheep. The monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurzat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 for the purchase of cows to increase the number of livestock. Nurzat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and to save money for repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.ru: Оинисо родилась в 1977 года. Она пережила трудную жизнь. Ее муж женился на другой женщине и бросил Оинисо. После развода она вернулась в родительский дом с двумя маленькими детьми. В родительском доме ей было очень трудно, так как ее родители жили бедно, а сама Оинисо нигде не работала. Она решила организовать свой бизнес купле продажей одежды и таким образом обеспечить себя и своих детей. Уже более 4 лет она торгует на местном рынке. Она старается обновить товар каждый сезон и таким образом привлечь больше покупателей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки товара на новый осенний сезон. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Oiniso was born in 1997. She has lived a hard life. Her husband married another woman and left her. After the divorce, Oiniso returned to her childhood home with two small children. It was very hard for her to live in her parents' house, as her parents were poor, and Oiniso herself did not work anywhere. 

Oiniso decided to start her own business, buying and reselling clothing and this way provide for herself and her children. She has been trading at the local market for more than four years already. She tries to renew her goods every season and this way attract new customers. 

Oiniso requests a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni to purchase goods for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pacita is 51 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Pacita has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. Pacita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo for her business.

Pacita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo for her business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. With four children still in school, Esterlita works very hard to provide for them.

Esterlita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Esterlita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, soft-drinks, canned goods, milk, bath soap, coffee, etc. 

Esterlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 31 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Genalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Genalyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more inventory like canned goods, soy sauce, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store.

Genalyn has been in this business for 3 years. Genalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like canned goods, soy sauce, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wenie

texts.en:
Wenie works hard to support her family. Wenie is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Wenie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell.

Wenie has been in this business for 7 years now.

Wenie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda is 46 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Armeda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Armeda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Armeda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Armeda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to start her own sewing business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old, married, and has one child. 

Marilou is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

Marilou has been in the pig fattening business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc., to sell for her buy and sell ready-to-wear business.

Norma has been in this business for 15 years. Norma earns additional income from direct selling personal products.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. Remedios is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Remedios has been in this business for 4 years now.

Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en:
Garnet is 46 years old and married with two children.

Garnet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, bread, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Garnet has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from videoke (karaoke) machine rental.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Garnet aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, bread, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 61 years old and married with six children. Juanita works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items, such as laundry soap, sugar, coffee, milk, biscuits, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar, flour, etc. for her business.

Rosario has been in this business for 10 years now.

Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar, flour, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is an experienced farmer from the village Gay of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and son. Lala's husband is an electrician in their village. To help her husband in earning a living for the family, Lala breeds a livestock of hens and cultivates beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, greens, and watermelon. Her son assists her greatly in selling the agricultural products in the market. Plant cultivation is a very important source of income for the family. Lala and her family currently need a loan of USD 1,500 to maintain and develop the plant cultivation.  They plan to purchase pipes, cellophane, and wire for building a greenhouse to cultivate plants. 

Lala and her family will highly appreciate the lenders support in helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, cellophane, and wire for building a greenhouse to cultivate plants

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en: Khanum is a farmer from Armavir city of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, her son, daughter-in-law, and two little grand-daughters (4 and 2 years old). Khanum's son works in the private sector. To be able to meet the daily needs of her family, Khanum breeds a livestock of cows and hens. This is the most important source of income for the family. As life gets more expensive day by day, she wants to enlarge the livestock a little bit to be able to make ends meet. Khanum needs a loan of USD 750 to purchase a cow. She and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful for helping them to collect the needed amount for the loan to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 52 years old and four of her children are still in school.

Imelda has a bakery business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, cream, salt, etc. for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, cream, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a farmer from the Kurtan village of Lori region. She lives with her husband, son and elderly pensioner mother-in-law. Anahit's husband works in the police. However, he alone cannot fully meet the family's needs. To help her husband in earning a living, Anahit is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, piglets and hens. Anahit also cultivates wheat and potato. Anahit's son helps her greatly with selling the agricultural products in the local market. Her small agribusiness currently needs some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will greatly improve the situation by enabling her to purchase three heifers and forage for the livestock.  

As this is Anahit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Anahit and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is from the village Tsaghkunq of Armavir region. He lives with his parents, his wife, and three-year-old son. Hakob's mother and wife work in a  school. Hakob and his father work in the private sector. Their salaries are very low, and they need alternative sources of income to earn a living. To be able to meet the family's basic needs, Hakob breeds a livestock of hens, and cultivates cabbage. He currently wants to enlarge his small agribusiness to cover his family's expenses more effectively. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a great support to this young initiative farmer and will enable him to purchase tomato seeds, fertilizers, cellophane, and bottles for the greenhouse to cultivate tomatoes, and to pay for the workforce and technical services. As Hakob does not have enough financial resources to use glass in the greenhouse, he will use bottles instead. 

Hakob will be very thankful to all the lenders for supporting his initiative to sustain and develop his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds, fertilizers, cellophane, and bottles for the greenhouse to cultivate tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is a Tlaxcalan dairy producer looking to reduce the amount of money he spends on fossil-fuel derived liquefied petroleum gas. The ever-rising costs make it harder for him and his family to pay for the fuel they use to cook and heat their bathwater. With his 6-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Juan will be able to process the abundant cow waste generated daily into biogas and biofertilizer. With this free, renewable source of energy and biofertilizer, he will be able to improve the economics of his small farm, allowing him and his family to continue the tradition for at least another generation. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Marie from Jui, Sierra Leone.  She is married with 3 children between the ages of 11 years and 18 years.  For the past 10 years, Marie has established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her community's standard of living.  She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and proper storage of her drugs.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase a pain table, more cholera medicine and malarial drugs for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to open a big pharmacy.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a pain table, more cholera medicine and malarial drugs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of grain, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita works hard to support her family. Nita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Nita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Nita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Nita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. Mary Jane earns additional income from pig fattening.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Feliqs

texts.en:
Feliqs is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife, and 9-year-old son. Feliqs is earning his living by providing taxi service to locals in Vanadzor. He drives a microbus and works day and night to be able to sustain his family's living. Feliqs's wife works at the local kindergarten, but her salary is very low, and is barely enough for covering daily costs. So Feliqs is the main breadwinner of the family. Now he needs financial support to be able to purchase 6 tires and pay for battery repair. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  This loan is very important for Feliqs and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase 6 tires and pay for battery repair

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is 37 years old, married, and has six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gerly is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gerly has been in the pig fattening business for 7 years, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is from Dalarik village where he lives with his wife and two grown-up children. Near the house where Rustam and his family live, Rustam owns a small store where he sells different products. Due to his kind and tireless work, people are doing their daily shopping only in Rustam's store.
 
As the income that Rustam gathers from the store is very important for his family's daily living, Rustam would like to expand it. Unfortunately, he has no money for purchasing new supplies and selling them at his store. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So Rustam will be very grateful to lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to sell in his store

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. Jasmin is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jasmin requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment and gear for fishing.

Jasmin has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and gear for fishing

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 48 years old and has 13 children. Leonora is married and five of her children are still in school.

Leonora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been raising pigs for three years and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 35 years old and married with four children who are currently in school. Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

Marichu runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store like snack foods, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc.

Marichu has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like snack foods, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, and noodles

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending, buying and selling bananas and selling school supplies. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Conegonda

texts.en:
Conegonda is 68 years old and widowed with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Conegonda has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Conegonda requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Conegonda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Conegonda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stuff for resale in the shop.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 29 years old, married, and has three children (one of which is still in school). 

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Vilma is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of body cream, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is from Metsamor town from Armavir region. He lives with his parents, sister, wife, and three little children. Together with his father Ara has been working in construction for 7 years. They are making cosmetic restoration to houses and earning money for their family. As the only source of income is construction, Ara works really hard to cover his family's daily costs. As autumn came, the orders of room renovations increases and Ara and his father have received a couple of offers, but unfortunately, they have no money for purchasing construction materials and tools which they need or their work. So Ara has requested this loan. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the loan is very important for Ara to be able to purchase the needed tools and materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and tools

loans.name: Karo

texts.en:
Karo is from Goris town. He has been involved in cargo transportation for 7 years. He owns a truck with the help of which he organizes cargo transportation of different products. He lives with his wife and two children and as the only breadwinner of the family, works hard to sustain their living.

As the winter is coming, Karo needs to change the truck's tires, but because of the family's other costs, Karo isn't able to save money for that. He has applied for this loan for purchasing winter tires for his truck. 

Karo has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Karo and he hopes for lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for winter tires.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with ten children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Nyamvula dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school, and one is grown up. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 15 years, she has been selling goat meat at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of  50,000 KES to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school and rest are grown ups. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Jumwa dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk,soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money to open a poultry selling business. However, she still operates her cereal selling business. 

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses. The loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting will help her to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her business.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is from Getafe, Bohol. She is 57 years old, married, and all her children are grown. For 37 years now, she has been making panggal (crab traps) which are used to catch crabs in their community. She is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo as the main raw material for her business. Her husband works as a farmer.

The income that she generate helps buy food for herself and her husband. In the future, Cesaria hopes to makes more crab traps for better profits.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to be used for crab traps.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife, and 10-year-old daughter. Arman works at local sports school as a trainer. As a hardworking family breadwinner, Arman also works as a taxi driver. He owns a car, with which he provides taxi service to locals. Currently his car needs to be renovated, but because of his family's daily needs, Arman isn't able to save money and renovate the car. He is asking for a loan to be able to purchase  tires and pay for renovations to the car. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan will greatly assist Arman to continue his business, and he will be able to earn income for his beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and pay for car renovations

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from Kapan town where he lives with his father and grandmother. For the past three years Edgar has worked as a builder and provides different services related to construction. As the only breadwinner of the family, Edgar works day and night and sustains his family's living. Now this hardworking young man, with many future goals, is asking for a loan to be able to purchase materials and tools needed for his work. 

Edgar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Edgar hopes for lenders' support and will be very grateful to them.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan lives with his wife, and small son in Stepanavan town. He has been driving a taxi for 3 years and sustaining his family with the income he earns from providing taxi service. 

Unfortunately, now Vachagan isn't able to drive his car as it needs to be renovated. Becuase of different other costs, Vachagan isn't able to cover costs related to the car. So he is asking for this loan to be able to renovate the car and purchase tires. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan is very important for Vachagan and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase tires and pay for the renovation of his car

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. Besides her fish selling business, she also operates a shop kiosk.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses. The loan of KES 35,000 that she is requesting will help her purchase milk, bread, soap, sweets and biscuits for her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, soap, sweets and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Nibunda

texts.en:
Nibunda is married and her three children, all of whom attend school, are the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She operates a cafe business making staples like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 25,000 Nibunda wants to purchase a stock of goods, like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods, like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his parents and sister. He has been selling clothing and dressmaking accessories for many years. Armen is purchasing and ordering different types of clothing from neighboring countries and selling to locals in Gyumri town.  

Now this hardworking man needs financial support. He plans to purchase new stock of knitwear, but has insufficient funds for that. So, Armen has requested this loan to be able to purchase new stock of knitwear. Because the autumn has come, it is already high time for selling knitwear and other clothing for the cold season.

Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan will greatly assist Armen to purchase needed products and continue his business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of knitwear for selling to customers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a designer from Gyumri town. She works at a local design shop as a designer and also takes different orders and works at her house. Anna lives with her three children and her parents-in-law, and her husband currently works in a neighboring country and tries to sustain his family's living.

Now, realizing that taking orders and working at home is more profitable for her, Anna decided to expand her business. For doing that, she needs to purchase accessories for design, baskets and working tools. This will allow her to provide designing service from her home. 

She has requested and currently has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is very important for Anna, and it will greatly assist her to continue her business and support her family's living.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for design, baskets and working tools

loans.name: Araqsi

texts.en:
Araqsi is from Mrgashat village of Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband, daughter, and son. The latter currently is in the army. Araqsi's daughter is a university student. Araqsi has been a teacher in the local school for several years. Her husband works in the village's self-governance body. All the family works hard to be able to cover their basic needs. Araqsi is also engaged in cultivation of wheat, cucumber, and several fruits (peach, apricot, plum, grapes, apple and pear). 

She currently needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase fertilizers, some materials for cultivation of grapes (wires, trestles, layers of grapes), and to pay for the harvesting services. The loan will help her greatly to sustain her agribusiness. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Araqsi was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Araqsi and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, some materials for cultivation of grapes (wires, trestles, layers of grapes), and to pay for the harvesting services

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel is from the village Nor-Armavir of Armavir region. His family consists of his elderly pensioner mother, his wife, and school age daughter, and son. Gnel works in the local school as a teacher of military subjects. He is the only breadwinner of the family and works hard to make ends meet. Gnel is also involved in the cultivation of tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, and watermelons. He currently wants to start cattle breeding as well. 

A loan of USD 2,000 will help him greatly enabling to purchase three steers and some forage for them (alfalfa and barley). He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Gnel was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Gnel will be thankful to all the lenders for helping him to develop his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three steers and some forage for them (alfalfa and barley)

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife, mother and three children. Karen has been involved in the production of iron doors for 5 years. He is making doors with original designs and sells locally. Due to his high quality work, Karen is well known among the local population of Gyumri town. 

Unfortunately, Karen's income is barely enough for covering the family's costs. As a father of three children, it is very difficult for him to supply all their needs. He needs financial assistance to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for his work. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the loan is very important for Karen and he hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for the canteen to improve it.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married mother of five children, three of whom are in school, while one is still young and one is an adult. She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water.

She prepares local brew using water, maize and chemicals and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase food ingredients such as maize flour, water and chemicals for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as maize flour, water and chemicals for the business.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Nalbandyan village of Armavir region. He lives with with his parents, his sister, his wife and two-year-old son. Hovhannes, his father and wife work in the same private organization. They are the ones who earn a living for the family. Hovhannes cultivates sunflowers, which he sells in the local market. 

As the family’s needs are growing day by day, he now wants to find alternative sources of income to be able to cover the family's needs more effectively. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a big support, enabling him to purchase three steers and some forage (alfalfa) for them. 

Hovhannes highly relies on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping him maintain his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three steers and some forage (alfalfa) for them.

loans.name: Noyemzar

texts.en:
Noyemzar is an experienced agronomist from Armavir. She lives with her elderly pensioner mother. 

To be able to take care of their basic needs, Noyemzar breeds hens and cultivates alfalfa and some fruits (peaches, plums, grapes and apples). Horticulture is the only source of income for Noyemzar. 

To be able to continue her agribusiness, Noyemzar needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 2,000 will enable her to purchase fertilizers, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, to buy special medication for the plants, and to pay for harvesting services. 

Noyemzar will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will in helping her to sustain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, to buy special medication for the plants, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en: Anzhela is an experienced famer from Sisian, a  city in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and son, who help her a lot in everyday farming activities. Anzhela with the help of her family breeds a livestock of cows, sheep, pigs, piglets, hens and turkeys. She is also engaged in beekeeping. Anzhela cultivates potatoes and several fruits as well (apricot, apple, pear and walnut). To sustain her agribusiness, Anzhela needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase some forage for the livestock.  As this is Anzhela’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Anzhela and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for the good will and support in collecting the needed amount of loan.

loans.use: to purchase some forage for her livestock

loans.name: Armanush

texts.en:
Armanush is an experienced farmer from the village of Tavshut in Shirak region. She lives with her son. The latter helps her a lot in everyday farming activities. Armanush breeds a livestock of cows, calves, sheep and hens. She also cultivates potatoes and grass. 

Armanush has an established agribusiness. Farming is the only source of income for the family. As the autumn is progressing, she needs to obtain a supply of forage for the livestock. A loan of USD 3,000 will help her greatly by enabling her to purchase some forage (grass, barley, wheat, sawdust) for the livestock. 

The lender's support will be highly appreciated, and will help this hard-working woman to continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of forage (grass, barley, wheat, sawdust) for her livestock.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a young farmer from Dilijan city of Tavush region. She lives with her husband and three little daughters (5, 3 and 1 years old). Karine breeds a livestock of cows and piglets. She also cultivates corn, beans, potatoes and several fruits (plums, figs, blood oranges, apples, pears and walnuts). 

Farming is the main source of family's income. As their needs are growing day by day, Karine needs to enlarge the livestock to be able to make ends meet. She needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase two pigs and some forage for the livestock. 

As this is Karine’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Karine and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in helping them collect the needed amount of loan

loans.use: to purchase two pigs and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norita is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Norita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Norita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Norita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Norita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flordeliz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins.

Flordeliz has been raising pigs for 2 years, and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of sixteen children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as wood, nails, paint, fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, such as wood, nails, paint, fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gracieta

texts.en:
Gracieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients, such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her restaurant business.

Gracieta has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from raising pigs.
