Gracieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old and has five children. Marcelina is married and two of her children are in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcelina has been farming vegetables for 9 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save money to expand her business and provide a financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 35 years old and has three children. Maricel is married and all of her children are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, farming root crops and vegetables in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and farming needs.

Maricel has been farming root crops and vegetables for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and farming needs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 46 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for 24 years, and earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling coconut .

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arcelina

texts.en:
Arcelina works hard to support her family. Arcelina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Arcelina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Arcelina has been in this business for 24 years now.

In the future, Arcelina would like to save money to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 54 years old and married, with nine children.

Nelfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nelfa has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for eight years, and she also earns  income from farming sugarcane and raising chickens.

Nelfa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Sylvia requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Sylvia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Teresita

In the future Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

She is planning to get her bachelor's degree in order to work in her field after graduation and start helping her parents financially as her parents are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them in paying  forher upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Fadhl

texts.en: Fadhl is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has been operating a spice store and has worked for a great part of his life. He benefitted from his first loan where he was enabled to expand his business and get married. He is an ambitious man who intends to increase his profits and attract more customers. So, he took out a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB that will enable him to buy basic household goods such as sauces, beans, pepper, cumin, seasoning, rice, cooking oil, and sugar, as well as other spices to stock his business. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy basic household goods to stock his spice store business

He is planning to get his bachelor's degree in order to work in his field after graduation and start helping his parents financially. However, his parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

She is planning to get her Bachelor degree in order to continue her studies through the Masters degree program.  She would like to work in her field of study after graduation so that she may help her husband to improve their living conditions and to cover the needs of their children.  But, unfortunately, she does not have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

She is planning to earn her degree in order to work in her field of study after graduation.  This will help her parents financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis and unable to pay for her semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

He is planning to get his Bachelor degree in order to work in his field of study after graduation and to start helping his parents financially.  But his parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay his upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

She is planning to earn her degree in order to work in her field of study after graduation and to start helping her parents financially.  Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Manar

She is planning to earn her degree in order to work in her field of study after graduation and to start helping her parents financially.  Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photograph published online.  For this reason her father appears in the photo.

Yasmin is an 18-year-old single lady from Dier Al-Balah.  She lives in a small house with her parents and two sisters.  Her father is a worker with a very low wage, and this is the only source of income for the family.  Yasmin is a first-year student of general sciences.

Yasmin took a USD loan from FATEN to help her buy a new laptop for her study.  This loan will help her to do her homework and reports.  Yasmin would like to finish her study and find a job in the future so she can help her parents.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for school.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda is 20 years old.  She lives in Mafraq, Jordan with her 5 siblings and parents.  Her father is retired.  Raeda is in her 2nd year studying for a Bachelor of Children Education degree.  She is planning to earn her Bachelor degree in order to work in her field of study after graduation and to help her parents financially.  Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old, single man from Dier Al-Balah.  For the past year, Mohammad has been working in a barbershop that he owns, using his experience from his previous job.  Mohammad likes his job and tries always to improve it.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy chairs and seats for his barbershop.  This will improve his business conditions and attract more customers.  Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chairs and seats for his barber shop.

loans.name: Zakria Group

texts.en:
Zakria is a group of two men and two women from Taiz, Yemen.  All of them are poor.  They applied for a 120,000 YER loan from AMB .  Khateba is a 38-year-old married woman with five children.  She is the leader of the group.  She is uneducated and lives in a poor area in Taiz.  

Her house is very old and in a miserable condition.  She has accumulated some money to renovate her house.  It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money.  She has started renovating her house but has run short on money.  She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy cement and carpentry materials.  She hopes that after the completion of the house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and carpentry materials for renovating her house.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is 22 years old.  She lives in Mafraq, Jordan with her family of 7 members.  Her father is a retired man who works at a private company.  Alaa is in her 3rd year studying for a Bachelor of English Language degree.  She is planning to earn her degree in order to work in her study field after graduation and to help her parents financially.  Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Al-Tawn Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Tawn and it consists of four ladies. Eyman is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She runs a business selling different types of sweets. Since she had a small business and there wasn't another bakery in the area, she attracted customers by making tasty sweets for them. Eyman not only uses her business as a source of income but also for social purposes, including providing the poor with sweets, especially during festivals and weddings seasons. Recently, Eyman's business has decreased leading to a decline in her profits. She has had to stop providing sweets to poor people because of the current situation facing Yemen. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to purchase sweet materials to use for her business. She hopes to increase her profits and continue providing sweets at social occasions.

loans.use: to purchase sweets to use for her business.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is 23 years old.  He lives in Irbid, Jordan with his 5 younger siblings and parents.  Ayman is in his 3rd year studying for a Bachelor of Computer Information Systems degree.  He is planning to earn his degree in order to work in his field of study after graduation and to start helping his parents financially.  But his parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab was born in 1957.  She is widowed and lives in Wihdat, Jordan with her 4 children.  She works as a teacher.  Because Zainab is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture.

One of Zainab’s sons is in his 2nd year studying for a Bachelor of Architect Engineering degree.  Zainab is trying her best to support herself and her children after her husband’s death.  But she is unfortunately facing financial problems and is unable to pay for her son’s upcoming semester fees.  She aims to help him reach his goal of graduating so that he may start working in his field and help improve their living conditions.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel was born in 1987. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a 27-year-old man who is currently studying for a Bachelor degree in Nursing, 2nd year. He also works as a nurse at a governmental hospital. 

Hadeel’s husband is planning to get his bachelor degree for the hope of being promoted to a better position at his work. Now she wants to help him pay for his upcoming semester fees, as he doesn't have enough money to pay them. 

For this reason, she applied for this loan. Because Hadeel is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living from farming rice in the Philippines. Agnes is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional pesticides and other farm supplies.

Agnes has been farming rice for 3 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy additional pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old young single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a humble house. For the past year, Mohammad has been working in a small shop for selling fruits and vegetables. It is a very profitable business, and this is the only source of income for the family.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more fruits and vegetables from the local farmers to resell. This will improve his business and his income will increase.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo in his shop.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables from the local farmers to resell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Eva has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Eva would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a conservative woman; she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. 

Amneh was born in 1969. She is married and has 7 children. Amneh’s oldest daughter, Raneem, who is 21 years old, is currently studying for a Bachelor's in Mathematics, 4th year. 

Amneh is currently facing financial problems which are not giving her the opportunity to pay for Raneem’s upcoming semester fees. Raneem is one step closer to graduating for the aim of continuing her study to get a Masters degree. For this reason, Amneh applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
 
She is a 23-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother of three daughters. Islam's husband has a mini market in the city. It is a good business and earns a good income, but always needs to be improved. 

Islam took a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy the needed stock for his mini market. This will improve his business and also help him increase his income.

loans.use: to buy the needed stock for her husband's mini market.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. For the past three years, Mohammad has been working in a linen store he owns. It is a very good business and his high season is in summer.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more needed stocks for his linen store. This will increase his sales and his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more needed stocks for his linen store.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan was born in 1971. She is married and a mother of 3. Her husband works in a trading company. 

Sawsan has been selling accessories, perfumes, and cosmetic products for 3 years. She started her project when she noticed that there are no accessory stores in the area. 

She is planning to raise the quantity of her products in the future in order to increase her profit. She currently wants to add new products for women's clothes to add variety to her project and raise her sales and income, which will make her a good support to her husband and children. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to trade.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is 22 years old. He is a student who dreams of being successful in the future. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking young man who works in a retail shop. He is trying to do everything so that his family will not have need for anything. He intends to buy some things for his house, so he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture to use for his house. Because his income isn't enough to cover household expenses, he hopes to open a electrician shop to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 50-year-old widow from a small village near Jenin. She is a mother of two sons and seven daughters. Her oldest son is twenty years old. Amal has been working in a beauty salon for many years. She has very good experience, and she is well-known in her city. She also sells creams, cosmetics, and perfumes.

Amal took a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to improve her beauty salon by obtaining new decorations. This will attract more customers, especially in the summer season. 

Amal appears in the photo in her salon.

loans.use: to improve her beauty salon by obtaining new decorations.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 53-year-old married woman from Jenin city. She is a mother of three sons and four daughters. Siham's husband is a worker with a very low wage. He can't afford all the family's expenses so his wife, Siham, helps him with part of the expenses. She has a very simple mini market in the city. It is a good business and earns a good income, but always needs to be improved. 

Siham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy the needed stocks for her mini market. This will improve her business, and her income will be increased.

Siham appears in the photo while she was working in her minimarket

loans.use: to buy the needed stocks for her mini market.

loans.name: Rawa

texts.en:
Rawa, is a 18 years, she lives with her parents. Because of her parent’s low income Rawa was forced to drop out from school and start her own sewing business in 2010. She bought an old sewing machine to assists her parents in their family's income. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.

Rawa is requesting a loan from Izdiharona to buy a new sewing machine, Iron, generator and renovate her workplace to increase her production. She is aiming to develop her business, reduce the working hours to help her old parents and hope to go back and finish high school.

The story of Rawa and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.

loans.use: A loan of $2,400 helped Rawa to buy sewing machine, generator, Iron and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab, is a 30 year old married Iraqi woman. She has three children. Zainab started sewing in 2004, when she bought an old sewing machine to assists her husband in their family's income. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices. Now that the family has grown and the expenses increased, Zainab decided to take a loan in order to improve the workplace condition and be able to increase her production, generating additional income to enable her children to go to school.

Zainab is requesting a loan from Izdiharona to buy new sewing machine, generator and renovate her workplace to increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and open a small sewing factory to increase the number of jobs and help more jobless women. 

The story of Zainab and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.

loans.use: A loan of $2,400 helped Zainab to buy sewing machine, generator and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Chnar's Group

texts.en:
Chnar, is a 25 years old married Iraqi woman and mother of two. She has two children. Chnar started sewing when she was 14 years old to support her family. After she got married she continued sewing using her old machine, during this period she became a well known person in her neighborhood and the old sewing machine is no longer efficient to keep up with the demand. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.

Chnar is requesting a loan from Izdiharona to new sewing machine and fabric so she can increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with providing the family income. 

The story of Chnar and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.

loans.use: A portion of Chnar's group's $ 2,400 loan helps a member to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem, who appears in this photos, is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah city in Palestine. He works in a small workshop in the city and gets a low income, which is not enough to cover his needs. He will get married soon and is preparing his new home.
 
Hazem has taken a Murabaha loan (explained below) with Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN). This loan will help him buy a solar system for heating water with sun power. This is very necessary for his home and will save electricity costs. 

This loan will help Hazem complete his home and get married as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water with sun power

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a 32-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He works as a soldier and gets a low salary. His salary is not enough to cover household expenses, so he bought a taxi to increase his income. He says that he feels comfortable because he can earn a daily income. Recently, his taxi has not been running well, so he is now requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi. He believes the additional income from this loan will help him to provide a better education for his child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an 18-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his parents in a simple house in the city. His father is an employee in the public sector; this is the only source of income for the family. 

Ibrahim is a student in his first year in a local university where he studies commerce. Ibrahim took a $550 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By applying this loan, Ibrahim will be able to do his homework and get good grades. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Fatehia

texts.en:
Fatehia is 28 years old. She is a married woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She works as a nurse in a hospital, getting a low salary. She is trying to do everything so that her family will not need for anything. She works daily from morning to evening and doesn't have time to get rest. Even though her salary is low, she loves her career because she feels comfortable to help patients be cured. 

She intends to buy home appliances, so she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy a fridge to use in the house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fridge to use in the house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Victoria has a shoe-repair business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase  thread, needles and other materials for shoe repair.
 
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for thread, needles and other materials for shoe repair.

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is from  Makiangayon, Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She  is 24 years old and married with one child. 

This year (2013), she applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing of all the benefits, she did not hesitate to become a member. She wants to maintain the status of being a member in good standing and will repay her obligations in a timely manner.

Angeline is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional inventory for her retail business. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and help the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory items for her retail business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita earns a living offering "ukay-ukay" (used clothing). She has had this business for two years.  She is 34 years old, married and lives in Gumahan, Josefina, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is now well-known for the nice quality of "ukay-ukay" she offers. She has already purchased some new stock and was able to save from it. Her products are affordable and have become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 10,000 per month.
  
Nenita is seeking a PHP 25,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items. This is a regular loan and would be repaid in few  months. In her two previous loans she never had a delinquency. Nenita is very diligent and loves accuracy which, only adds to the effective management of her business.

loans.use: To buy new stock for her customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 66-year-old widow and resident of Poblacion Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has four children, of whom two are in school.  Starting with capitalization of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she sells snacks to earn a living and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in August 2009 and has taken out 13 loans. 

Now she is applying for 30,000 PHP to buy additional equipment for her business. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for the canteen and other services.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and a widow. She earns a living through teaching at Litapan, Josefina, Z.D.S. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy housing materials and to pay for labor for the house repair. 

Marissa deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy housing materials and to pay for labor  for the house repair.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 47 years old, and she is married with two kids. 

In 2009, Loreta applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Loreta has asked for financial assistance of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional raw ingredients for her herbal medicine business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her herbal medicine business.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie, a 30-year-old woman from Ozamiz City, is married and gifted with three kids. 

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in a banana retailing business from which to earn a living. It has operated for two years already. Now, she is applying a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, of which she became a member and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. This loan is intended to purchase construction/raw materials needed for a house repair. The income from her business shall pay off to the loan she requested from PMPC. She dreams of nothing more than to have a decent living, a happy and healthy life with her family, and an adequate income out of her business.

Girlie deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase construction/raw materials needed for a house repair.

loans.name: Vergilita

texts.en:
Vergilita is married with three children. Vergilita is 66 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Vergilita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional goods such as sardines, noodles, chocolates, candies, junk foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, salt, sugar, toothpaste and other products to sell.

Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Vergilita hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like sardines, noodles, chocolates, candies, junk foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, salt, sugar, toothpaste and other products.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is widowed with five children. Jesusa is 66 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Jesusa sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) selling such items as vinegar, salts, sauces, oils, sugar, spices, candies, sardines, noodles, soaps, drinks, toothpaste, detergents, etc.

Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Jesusa hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional goods such as vinegar, salts, sauces, oils, sugar, spices, candies, sardines, noodles, soaps, drinks, toothpaste, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Khly

texts.en: Khly is 44 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband (who is in the picture) purchases cattle to resell. He makes an income of $8 each day. One of her children in a garment worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Khly is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to financially support her family. In the future, she would like to expand this business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita resides in San Pedro, Polanco, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has three children. Her husband is a government employee while she runs a retail store specializing in selling vegetables and fruits to make a living.  She had joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more additional goods like fruits and vegetables for sale. She always finds ways to earn an income to support her children's education. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more additional goods like fruits and vegetables for sale

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is 63 years old, married and has five adult children. She has engaged in a sari-sari store business for almost 13 years, and she earns a monthly income of 3,000. 

Milagrosa has requested a new loan to purchase more products she could offer to her customers. Milagrosa has been a member of Paglaum MPC for seven years. She hopes to generate more savings from her business and to be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase sale items for her sari-sari store to gain additional customers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe.  She is 30 and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Her partner is Ramelito, who is a mason.  She, together with her partner, manage their household and children while operating her businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Fe operates a food stall. She sells snacks like hotdogs and some chicken parts like intestine, blood, head and other parts. In the Philippines, these chicken parts are eaten by adding flavoring and spices. They are grilled until cooked. These snacks are sold from afternoon until evening. She also runs a variety store and a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ingredients for her food stall such as hotdogs and chicken parts. She will also use the loan in buying grocery items and merchandise products to resell.

Fe dreams to expand her business and hopes to be with her family in every seasons of life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients such as hotdogs and chicken for her food stall and grocery items to resell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial boost with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Melanie hopes to expand her business and have her own shop. She dreams to have a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en: Fredelyn has two children and resides in San Pedro, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She has run a general store for more than two years to make a living. Recently, she joined GDMPC and she gained access to microfinance services. She borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional goods like sardines, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. In the near future, she want to have a better living and be able to send her children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like sardines, soft drinks, biscuits, etc.

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Uldarica

texts.en:
This is Uldarica, 53, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Her partner is Edgardo, a mason, and they have children. She, together with her partner, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Uldarica operates a business making peanut butter. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed in making her product from the market, process it and then repack and sell them per piece to individuals, general store owners and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic jars. She also sells frozen and processed foods and she has a videoke machine for rent. She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ingredients to make peanut butter like peanuts, oil and dairy cream and materials like jars and sealer.

Uldarica hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients to make peanut butter like peanuts, oil and dairy cream and materials like jars and sealer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married. She is running a business in her house by selling noodles,  coffee, sugar, salt, fanta and water. She is making a good income from selling and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to shop and she sells things every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $100.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fanta and water

loans.name: Esperanza - 2V Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA – 2V”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, venta de celulares, venta de tenis, tienda de barrio, elaboración de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de celulares; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su pareja, hace diez años, al observar que este producto es ampliamente comerciable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de celulares) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud y los consultorios.
texts.en:
The "Esperanza - 2V" communal bank is starting its fifth loan cycle with "Pro Mujer", though the VIlla Tejada regional office.  The group has eight members, and is directed by a board that has Lidia as the secretary.  The members have different businesses, including a dressmaking workshop, selling phones, selling trainers, a grocery store, and producing shoes.

This loan will benefit the small business entrepreneurs in Lidia's group.  Lidia tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" two years ago following an invitation from a friend who was already a member.  Lidia currently has a business selling mobile phones and she says that she started this business with her husband ten years ago when she realised that this was a profitable product.

Lidia is applying for this loan to increase her working capital - she will use it to buy mobile phones from bulk sellers in the city of El Alto, before selling them on.  This work has allowed Lidia to earn an income to support her family as best as possible.  Lidia has a partner and they have two children.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer", Lidia tells us that she likes the health and business training.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она имеет высшее образование. Она работает в средней школе учительницей. Ее муж тоже работает учителем в средней школе. Они живут на полученную зарплату. Их зарплата не хватает, чтобы сделать сбережения и достроить дом, который они начала строить несколько лет назад. Шахло имеет 3 детей, и они еще не трудоспособные. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки шифера, древесины, цемента и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahlo is a hardworking woman. She is 39 years old. She has a university education. She works in a secondary school as a teacher. Her husband also works as a teacher  in a secondary school. They live on their wages. Their salaries are not enough to save up to finish building their home, which they started to construct several years ago. Shahlo has 3 children but they are not yet of working age. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy slate, lumber, cement, etc. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy slate, lumber and cement to finish building her house.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en: Mr. Amgalan, who is 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has worked as a senior accountant at a television firm since 1997. His wife quit her banking job and is now taking care of household matters. Their two children both study at a university. He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. The advantage of a natural gas vehicle is that it wastes less fuel and emits cleaner carbon dioxide into the atmosphere compared to all engines. The borrower will use the car for transportation purposes.

loans.use: to buy an automobile that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.ru: Манижа трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка, которому 2 года. Манижа является студенткой 4 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Она учится в факультете Финансы и кредит. Манижа учится хорошо и отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Ее муж Умедчон, который работает торговым представителем, данное время тоже не имеет денег, чтобы помочь жене. Манижа запрашивает займ  для оплаты учебного договора. Это второй кредит который она берет. Она получила первый кредит для оплаты обучения за третий год, и это второй кредит она просит чтобы заплатить за четвертый год обучения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Manizha is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is married and raising a child, who is two years old. Manizha is a fourth year student at the Tajik State University of Commerce. She studies at the faculty of Finance and Credit. Manizha studies well and actively takes part in the social life of the university. 

Manizha needs to pay for her tuition, but she does not have the money. Her husband, Umedchon, who works as a sales representative, currently does not have money to help her either. Manizha requests a loan to pay for her tuition. This is the second loan she takes. She received the first loan to pay for her third year tuition, and this second loan she requests to pay for the fourth year tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
Janett is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. For years, she has seen the growth of her food stall and how the loan has really helped. The loan was also helpful for the education of her child. Additionally, the income she has earned as a result of the loan was useful for their everyday expenses at home. Janett also has an electronic loading station for additional income.

Janett would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her child. Janett looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janett dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week so that she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Romana to improve her business. She has a general store where many people come to buy grocery items every day. With the loan, she will buy additional supplies for her store such as water, eggs, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt and milk. Romana has been involved in business activities since 2002. Romana feels comfortable running her business and enjoys having the ability to earn money every day.

Running a business has made Romana independent because she can be responsible for herself and for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy water, eggs, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt and milk.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дилором имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе учительницей. Дилором еще и портниха. Она шьет женские национальные платья. Дилором прошла тренинг «Добейся Успеха» и организовала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она справляется и с бизнесом и с педагогической деятельностью. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом и с такой целью она обращается за займом. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправил достаточно денег, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilorom is 40 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Dilorom has a university education in pedagogy. She works as a teacher in a secondary school. Dilorom also works as a seamstress. She sews women's ethnic dresses. Dilorom went through the training course "Get Ahead" and organized her business of sewing women's clothing. She does a good job of managing both her business and her teaching duties. She wants to repair her house and is requesting a loan for that reason. Her husband is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation and does not send enough money home to pay for home repairs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy construction materials like cement, lumber, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, and lumber for repairing her house

loans.name: Njiyobiri Group

texts.fr:
Clothilde fait partie du groupe Njiyobiri et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a  39 ans et est mariée  à Stany, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont  3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, farine de maïs, savons,...) depuis 11 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de haricot, savons, farine de maїs,…  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Clothilde is part of the Njiyobiri group and lives in Gitega. She is 39 years old and is married to Stany, a merchant. Together they have five children of whom three attend school.

She has been running a grocery shop (beans, cornflour, soap, ...) for the past 11 years.

This is her third credit loan with Turame. Once the KIVA credit is granted, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of beans, soap, cornflour, to sell retail and earn more.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a lot of beans, soap, cornflour, to sell retail and earn more

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DIAKALIA est âgé de 35 ans et vit avec son épouse et ses deux enfants dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
DIAKALIA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’aliments volailles. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant d’aliments volailles. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième prêt qui servira à acheter des ingrédients pour la fabrication d’aliments volailles par lui même et revend en détail à OUELESSEBOUGOU et dans les villages environnants  à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
DIAKALIA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakalia is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in the Koulikoro region.

Diakalia did not have the opportunity to go to school. Very soon he became interested in income-generating activities, in particular the commerce of poultry feed. He learned the business from his maternal uncle, who was once a great poultry feed merchant

In order to satisfy his increasing number of customers, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second loan he will use to buy ingredients to prepare poultry feed himself, which he will then retail in Ouelessebougou and surrounding villages, for cash or on credit, to a mixed clientele.

Diakalia hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs which will be used to repay the loan and for reinvestment in the business activities.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of poultry feed

loans.name: Navruza

texts.ru: Навруза молодая и добросовестная женщина. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Навруза более 12 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур на 2 га земли. Она в основном выращивает овощи и зерно как лук, пшеница, помидор и т.п. Она дополнительно занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает как крупно - рогатого скота, так и мало рогатого скота. Навруза является основной кормилицей семьи. Ее муж строитель. Навруза должна сделать осенний посев пшеницы и лука, но не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Navruza is a young and honest woman. She is 30 years old. She is married and has two young children. For more than 12 years, Navruza has practiced crop farming on two hectares of land. She primarily grows vegetables and grains like onions, wheat, tomatoes, etc. She also practices cattle rearing. She fattens up both cattle and livestock. Navruza is the main provider for her family. Her husband is a construction worker. Navruza needs to do her autumn sowing of wheat and onions, but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She is a requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the autumn sewing season.

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.ru: Гулшода целеустремленная женщина. Она живет вместе со своей семьей на юге Таджикистана. В ее районе многие люди занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания.  Она более полтора года занимается земледелием. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. Дети еще не имеют нормального источника дохода. Она является основной кормилицей в семье. Для Гулшода земледелие, то есть выращивание картошки, морковки, пшеницы не только для него является источником дохода, но и любимым занятием. Она с удовольствием работает на поле с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Она планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000  сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulshoda is a self-motivated woman. She lives with her family in the south of Tajikistan. In her district, many people practice crop farming and earn an income to live on. For more than a year and half, Gulshoda has been practicing crop farming. She is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. Her children do not have a normal source of income. She is the main provider in her family. For Gulshoda, crop farming (growing potatoes, carrots and wheat) is not only a source of income, but also a favorite pastime. She gladly works in the fields from early in the morning to late at night. She is planning to develop her business, but she does not have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing crops.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan resides in Gulayon, Dipolog City in Zamboanga del Norte, along with her family. She has two children and her husband is earning income by providing motor transportation while she runs a general store to make a living.
Joan joined GDMPC and she borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippine peso) from GDMPC micro credit to buy dried fish, rice and corn grits to sell in addition to her current working inventory. She hopes to see her children successful and their general living situation improved in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, rice and corn grits to sell

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr: ALOU est un tailleur et couturier âgé de  29 ans, qui est célibataire, résidant dans la ville de Koutiala.  Du à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études primaires raisons pour laquelle il s’est accroché à la couture. D’après lui, cette activités est très rentable et  lui procure assez de revenus surtout à l’approche des fêtes. Il reçoit beaucoup de commande par  mois.  Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité, ALOU a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à  son 3ème prêt  individuel.  Ce prêt servira à acquérir des matériels pour la couture : tissus, dentelles, fils de broderie. Il effectue son activité à son atelier de couture dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte au comptant et à crédit. Avec l’élargissement de son activité, ALOU compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 75 000 FCFA par mois, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Alou is a single 29-year-old tailor and dressmaker, who lives in the city of Koutiala. For social reasons, he was unable to pursue his primary education, which is why he became involved in sewing.

According to him, this business is very profitable and provides him with enough income, especially with the approach of Christmas. He gets a lot of orders per month.

For good customer satisfaction and to expand his business, Alou approached the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  where he is on his third individual loan.

This loan will be used to acquire sewing material: fabric, lace, embroidery threads. He runs his business at his sewing workshop in the city of Koutiala, for a mixed clientele, in cash and on credit.

With the expansion of his business, Alou expects to make monthly profits of 75,000 CFA francs he will use to repay loan interests, meet his personal needs and reinvest the remainder in his activity.

loans.use: buy sewing material

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 56 years of age. She is a hardworking woman. She operates a sari-sari, a general store business, to support her family, with this she's earning 400-500 PHP (Philippine peso) every day. Lourdes's income is not enough due to the high cost of living. She therefore pushed herself to ask for a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. With the loan, she hopes to increase her profits every day in order to be able to meet her expenses and to save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is an entrepreneur and resides in Anastacio, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte with her only child. To make a living, she sells grocery items in her general store. On weekends, she also sells meat in the market. 
Jennifer needs additional capital to improve her business. Without hesitation, after having an orientation about GDMPC, she joined and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippine peso) to purchase additional grocery goods and home use products to sell. 
She is thankful to GDMPC for giving the small entrepreneur a chance to improve their business ability to augment their living. She wants to improve her store and the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and home use products for sale

loans.name: Ajay

texts.en:
Ajay is 30 years old, a differently-able person living with his parents, brother and sister. He has been engaged in the activity of tailoring for the last eleven years with his one sewing machine to help his father financially. He takes orders from his customers for stitching their dresses. He earns 3000 INR per month from  this activity which is not sufficient for his family.

Ajay has a plan to purchase two new sewing machines and fabrics for his shop so that he can take more orders from his existing customers and increase his customer base; and earn more. He says, “I can earn up to 8,000 INR per month after adding new machines to my shop and I will involve my sister too in this business to help me.” 

He has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR for purchasing new sewing machines, fabrics and appointing work force to help him. He wants to help his father financially in getting his sister married and to save some money for his future.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a new sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Nalini

texts.en:
Nalini is 42 years old, a divorced woman living with her parents and a son who is doing schooling. After her divorce with her husband she came back to her paternal house and started living with her parents, but she felt like a burden on her parents as her father already had the responsibility of her mother, so she planned to help her father financially and started a small tailoring shop with her one sewing machine, nineteen years ago. She took orders from her customers for stitching their dresses. She earns 3000 INR per month from this activity which is not sufficient for her family.

Nalini has a plan to purchase two new sewing machines and fabrics for her shop so that she can take more orders from her existing customers, increase her customer base; and earn more. She says, “I can earn up to 8,000 INR per month after adding new machines to my shop.” She has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR for purchasing new sewing machines, fabrics and appoint work force to help her. She wants to help her father and save some money for her son's education.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing new sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Annapurna Biswlata Self Help Group

texts.en:
Swarna is a 42-year-old lady living in Khurda, Odisha with her parents, her husband and her children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past four years, Swarna has been engaged in running a grocery shop in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Swarna is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Annapurna Biswlata Self Help Group (SHG). There are twelve members in the group and all are women. 

The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture, milk selling and some have grocery shops. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 180,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase oil, sugar, biscuits, soap, shampoo, rice, etc. for her grocery shop. She has a dream to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing oil, sugar, biscuits, soap, shampoo, rice, etc. for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Kaberi Shg Group

texts.en:
Kaberi Self Help Group is a group consisting of 10 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they were all facing the same poverty, so they planned to start a vegetable business where they can provide fresh, quality vegetables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Rina, who was selected as their president. Rina is a 39-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children, who are students. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near her village.  She produces and sells vegetables to her customer and has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village and nearby market. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village and nearby market. She has a plan to make her vegetable business bigger and produce more higher quality vegetables to satisfy her customers.  She, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 180,000 INR to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing high quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khetreswari Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2012, 10 women from a village in Odisha stepped out and formed a group named Khetreswari Self Help Group. They help each other, share their problems and solve them together. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. Rankamani is the president of this group and has one cow. She sells milk in her village. She wants to purchase one more cow so that she can sell more milk and earn more profit. She provides vaccine and fodder to her cow when it's required.

Early in the morning, she takes the cow to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks food for her family. She resumes taking care of her cow, feeding it at home. Her husband assists her in selling the milk. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase one more cow. She, along with her group  has requested a loan of 150,000 INR for her group so that they can earn more and control their family's cash flow.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a cow.

loans.name: Laxmi Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2012, 10 women from a village of Khurda district, Odisha, India stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named Laxmi Self Help Group. The members of this group are all women. One of them is Mrs. Carubala, who was selected as their president. The lady sitting second from the right hand side in the photo is Carubala. 

Curubala is 49 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing paddy cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her village and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on the leadership of the group and started the cultivation of paddy and sells it in her village. She has very good relationships with her customers as she sells paddy or rice, whichever is required by the customers, on time. 

Now she has a new idea, which is to lease more land for cultivation so that she can do paddy cultivation on a larger scale. For this reason, she and her group have requested a loan amount of 250,000 INR to purchase seeds, fertilizers and for leasing farmland.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and  for leasing farmland.

loans.name: Maa Bhaghei Self Help Group

texts.en:
These 12 women from the small village of Odisha came together and formed Maa Bhaghei SHG in 2012. Naru was selected as the leader of Maa Bhaghei SHG. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her husband has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. 

As a farmer, her husband has sound knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. Whatever they earn is not sufficient to manage their family expenses. She, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 120,000 INR to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay  labor charges. It would be helpful to increase their income so they will be inspired and will do more. She says that she wants to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sushama is a 44-year-old woman married to a worker of Samantarpur village in Odisha, India. The couple has three children. Sushama lives with her children, husband and her in-laws. She takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with the family expenses, she has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling it to distributors for the past four years. She supplies her paddy and rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Sushama, along with seven other women from her village, formed a group that is Maa Mangla SHG and Sushama was elected president of this group. The lady sitting on the left-hand side in the photo is Sushama. Sushama, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 160,000 INR to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover operational costs. Sushama and her group believe it would be very helpful to cultivate more paddy so that they can earn more. She wants to give a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover their operational costs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Tamano

texts.ru: Тамано сельская замужняя женщина в возрасте 27 лет. Она проживает в районе Дж.Руми. Ее муж дехканин. Он на 0,15 га участке земли выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру. Тамано тоже решила начать зарабатывать. Так как при дворе их дома имеется сарай для содержания скота, Тамано хочет заняться животноводством, а именно овцеводством. Она считает, что разведение овец дело не трудоемкое и не требует больших усилий. К тому же это очень прибыльный бизнес так как мясо ягненка всегда в спросе. Чтобы начать свой бизнес Тамано запрашивает кредит. Она планирует каждый месяц закупать по 15 голов овец и после одного месяца откорма, перепродавать на скотном рынке. Благодаря кредиту у нее будет собственный бизнес со стабильным доходом, что позволит увеличить бюджет семьи.
texts.en: Tamano is a 27 year old married woman from the countryside. She lives in the J. Rumi district. Her husband is a farmer. He practices crop farming on a 0.15 hectare of land. Tamano decided to start earning money as well. As there is a barn for holding livestock in the backyard of their house, Tamano wants to practice animal husbandry, specifically raising sheep. She thinks that sheep rearing is not overly time-consuming and does not require a lot of effort. It is a very profitable business for those who do it, as lamb meat is always in demand. In order to start her business, Tamano is requesting a loan. She plans to buy 15 sheep every month, and after the course of a month, fatten them up and resell them at the livestock market. Thanks to the loan, she will have her own business with a stabile income, which will allow her to increase her family's budget.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep to start her sheep rearing business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta is single, and has a child. She runs a general store in the village of Gulayon, Dipolog City. She has been selling goods for more than five years. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services of the cooperative, and has borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice and feeds for sale, in addition to her working inventory capital. She plans to expand her business using the profit she gains from this working capital.  In future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice and feeds for sale in addition to her working inventory capital

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
This is Jessica. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional pigs and stock of feeds for her piggery. The loan is also useful for the education of her children. She is in this business now for six years. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jessica hopes to have another piggery and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to have time for God after a long week of work.    

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Maa Mangala Selp Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Mangla Self Help Group is a group consisting of 10 members where all are women. They come from a small village of Khurda, Odisha, India. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back they were all facing the same situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they could provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Mrs. Sarojini who was selected as their president. 

Sarojini is a 39-year-old lady, living with her husband and her three children who are at their schooling. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Sarojini has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple items in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she along with her group has requested a loan amount of 150,000 INR to utilize in purchasing items like betel, rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing betel, rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. for  her grocery shop.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 41-year-old charcoal seller. She is married to Joseph who also contributes to their income; they are blessed with three children. Pauline has been selling charcoal for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 20,000, which she uses to provide for her family. Pauline is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the anticipated profits from her business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to build a comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Naran

texts.en:
Naran is 42 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  Her older daughter studies at the university in Taiwan and the younger daughter goes to high school in Mongolia. 

Naran is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 MNT, which she will use to pay for her older daughter's tuition fees. In her opinion, the best thing she can do for her daughter is invest in education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Om-Kaream Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Kaream. This group consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 250,000 YER. Shafiqa is the president of this group. She is a 38-year-old married woman who has one child. Her husband works hard every day to cover the expenses of his family. She decided to help him and started a small business. She currently has a business selling ladies' clothes. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. She requested a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB to be used to buy clothes. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Al-Mostgbal Al-Bsatin Group

texts.en:
Al-Mostgbal Al-Bsatin Group consists of four women from Aden, Yemen. They are applying for a 320,000 YER loan through Al-Amal to buy women's clothes to sell. The loan will be split among them.

Nour is a member of this group.  Her husband works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothing, but unfortunately the money he makes is really not enough to support the family adequately.

A few years ago, Nour decided to help her husband with the family’s finances. In the beginning she started going door to door selling products that only earned her a small income. Then she started selling clothes.

She intends to have her own independent business selling them. For this reason she will receive a 80,000 YER portion of the loan to buy clothes in order to expand her business. She hopes that she will make a profit selling a lot of clothes to new clients in different quarters and varied places in her city.

loans.use: to buy clothes in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sakhai is a 32-year-old lady living in the small village of  Kumarbasta, Khurda, Odisha, India, with her two children who are studying in school. Sakhai is a housewife who is a very hardworking and responsible lady. Sakhai has formed a group that is Maa Mangla self help group with 11 other women from her village, and members of the group have selected Sakhai as their president. The common goal of this group is to increase their business activity.

Sakhai is involved in farming a paddy and selling at the market in the Khurda district in Odisha, India. She already has had this business for four years and it is going very well. 

At this time, Sakhai, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 120,000 INR to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that it would be very helpful to strengthening the business and to fulfilling client demands.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and tools for cultivating the paddy.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Self Help Group

texts.en:
The responsible Maa Mahalaxmi Self Help Group is made up of ten members. All the members of Maa Mahalaxmi Self Help Group are women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Kasturi, who was selected as their president. 

Kasturi is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is engaged in the activity of selling goats and cow’s milk in her village and the nearby market. She purchases goat kids and rears them and when they grow up, she sells them to the butcher. 

She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 150,000 INR for purchasing more goat kids and a cow for getting a greater amount of milk to earn more profit. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time. She and all the group members want to give a better standard of life to their family and also want to save some money for their future.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing goat kids and a cow.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). He has been taking loans for his business which have enabled him to sustain his business. He applied for this loan buy more building materials and to finish his house.

Johnson lives in a rural area  in Bugongi, Rukungiri District; he is aged 36 years and married with four children. He hopes to finish his house and educate his children so as to have a happy family in the future with a good business.
