Johnson and his family thank UGAFODE for the financial assistance which has enabled them to sustain the family business, and Johnson is now going to be able to house his children in a better family.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Tumurtogoo

texts.en: Mrs. Tumurtogoo, 48 years old, lives with her husband and son in an old brick house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching at elementary school since 2009. Her husband and son are cobblers and work at a shoe-making factory. She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase bricks, cement, vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass. Using those materials, she and her husband will repair and insulate their old brick house. As a result, the family will burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old, married to Joyce, and they have four children who are in school.

He is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru. He has been in this business for twenty years and has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy fertilizer and pay for labor, after repaying his previous loans on time. With anticipated profits, he plans to buy dairy cows.

He hopes to apply for bigger loans from Kadet Ltd to enable him to expand his farming business to a large scale.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 27 years old, married to Maleon, and they have one child.

He is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which he has practiced for four years, and he also has an electronic money transfer business known as M-pesa. He has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd after repaying his previous loans on time, to enable him to buy a dairy cow. With anticipated profits, he plans to boost his farming business.

He hopes to boost his business and improve his family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a single lady of 37 years who has one child and lives with her niece, who is also in school. She keeps poultry in Ikinu in the outskirts of Kiambu. She has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.

This will be Teresia's first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy one-day-old chicks and chicken feed. In future, she wants to keep more than 1,500 broiler chickens to meet all her demand.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and one-day-old chicks.

loans.name: Omm Saikrishna Self Help Group

texts.en:
Omm Saikrishna Self Help Group consists of nine women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. 

One of them is Nandini, who was selected as the president of Omm Saikrishna Self Help Group. The lady sitting second from the right side in the photo is Nandini. Nandini is 25 years old and is staying with her husband and her 5-year-old child. Her child is in school. She hopes to see her child as an officer in a company. 

She has three acres of land in her village and she is using her land to grow sugarcane. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She has requested a loan of 135,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maryticron

texts.en:
Maryticron is a single lady of 31 years and the mother of two children.

She runs a general shop in Ikinu in the outskirts of Kiambu. She has been in this business for one year and gets a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be Maryticron's first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc. In future, she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ulaanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ulaanbaatar, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling consumer goods since 2006 and brings his goods from a China border town. His wife works as a janitor at a private firm. 

He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase shingles, fiberglass, foam and vacuum-insulated windows. Using those materials, he will renovate his old house and then his family will live in a comfortable and warm place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, fiberglass and foam.

loans.name: Karimi

texts.en:
Karimi lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which has very green land especially good for agriculture production. She has two children and has been doing this work for 20 years. Her primary income sources are milk and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "[The] good market for produce." Her biggest challenge is poor transportation. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Mwari.

Karimi was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Better services." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Savings are used as collateral."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Karimi replied, "Help educate children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Karimi owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets and a TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a married woman, aged twenty-three years. She has three children and she lives in Kyotera town with her family. Her children are six, four and two years old. She also takes care of other two kids who lost their parents.

Prisca is a business lady who operates a drug shop. She works seven days a week and each day she works for fourteen hours. She supplements her family income with some money she gets from renting her two motorcycles every day. She has been in this business since 2007.

Prisca started this business with the aim of earning a living and also delivering services to the community after failing to get a job related to what she studied. She has applied for this loan in order to re-stock her business (buy more drugs) since this being the rainy season, an increased number of people are falling sick. She extends her services to fellow residents in Kyotera.

Her greatest dream is to expand this business so that it can be a wholesale centre. But she still faces the challenge of limited capital to invest in the drug shop. She is grateful to Kiva through Ugafode that she has been able to save lives because of the loans advanced to her. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Fatima to improve her business. 

She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as salt, sugar, coffee, soap, cigarettes and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Fatima independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, coffee, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 29-year-old married man and has three children. Due to a bad situation he faced, he was not able to complete his education.

He lives in a small house that is very uncomfortable for his family in Taiz, Yemen. Unfortunately, he faces a difficulty in the transfer of water to his home due to the lack of money to buy a water tank for his house. Therefore, he asked for a loan of 60,000 YER (Yemen rials). In the future, he looks forward to finishing his house so that he can provide better living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his house.

loans.name: Omm Sai Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sanjulata, a citizen from a rural village located in the Khurda district, is 41 years old and lives with her husband and her three children, all of whom are dependent on her. 

For the last four years, she has been engaged in the activity of farming a paddy and selling vegetables. Her husband supplements their income by working as a laborer. With the current business, she can earn about 5,000 INR per month, and that is very low for her monthly expenses. 

She, along with eight other women from her village, formed a group, and she was elected as group president. She and her group members have requested a loan of 135,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds and to pay for a work force. She hopes to earn more income after getting the loan so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, pesticides, seeds and to pay work force fees.

loans.name: Tseregjil

texts.en: Mr. Tseregjil, 30 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working at a building company since 2010. His wife is a saleswoman and working at the same firm for seven years. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to make an extension to his old house by buying building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and shingles. After the extension, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they won't burn as much coal as they used to due to heat loss. Less coal usage means less pollution in air as coal is considered the main source of pollution according to state research.

loans.use: to make an extension to his house

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya, 40 years old, lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She recently began to work as an operator at a private firm. Before this job, she had run a photographic studio between 2008 and 2010. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy a sofa. The sofa will make the house more comfortable and give her more enthusiasm to work harder. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a sofa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old, married to Rachael, and they are supporting five children who are in school.

He is in the quarry business in Ndunyu Njeru; he has operated it for fifteen years and has applied for a fifth loan from Kadet Ltd after repaying his previous loan on time. This loan is to enable him to buy building stones for sale. With anticipated profits, he plans to boost his business.

He hopes to apply for bigger loans from Kadet Ltd to enable him to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy building stones for sale.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a man of 30 years, married and a father of two children. He repairs mobiles phones and also does a car wash business in Ikinu in the outskirt of Kiambu. He has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Lucas' first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a tool used in repairing mobile phones. In future, he wants to open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase tools used for mobile phone repair.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a repeat borrower in her third loan cycle. She is a widow and a mother of six. In addition to her children, she looks after her sister’s children because her sister passed away two years ago.

Sarah is involved in the business of collecting plastics and other scrap materials. Her daily job routine is waking up early in the morning and moving around the city in search of old plastic materials. She sells them to different factories for recycling. However, this does not only benefit Sarah through earning a living, it’s also a benefit to the environment since she is involved in reducing waste. She wants the loan to buy scrap.

Sarah is a hardworking lady and because of this, she has managed to educate her children and provide other basic materials for them. Sarah approached Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. (MDI) for a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy scrap.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She has one child and has been doing this work for 15 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "High returns." Her biggest challenge is the lack of rainfall. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Kairu.

Irene was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Interest on a reducing balance." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Co-guarantee mechanism."

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family?" Irene replied, "Improve living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Irene owns the following: "cow, poultry, motorcycle," but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, running water, a TV and a DVD, but does not have electricity, solar power or a sewing machine.

loans.use: to construction a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 32-year-old lady from Mbale town which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is a widow who was left with one child; she supports two people in her family, but she has one child who is eight years old.

She has a boutique and salon, a business she has been doing for the last four years, and gets a monthly income of Kes 14,000. She has requested a loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase her working capital. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to educate her daughter and grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase curtains, clothes and other items for her boutique and salon.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 33-year-old lady from Kanyamedha in Kisumu which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family. She is married to Mr. Otieno and has two children who are 2 and 8 years old.

She has a beauty salon and she has been doing this business for the last six years and gets a monthly income of Kes 25,000. She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to add more stock to her business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to educate her children and have a stable income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg, 52 years old, lives with her daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. Three years ago, she retired from work and since that time she has been running her cafeteria. Her son works at the police department as law enforcer. Her daughter is graduating from her university next summer. 

Oyunbileg is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam to renovate her old house as preparation for the coming winter. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating and  release fewer pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, y sus nietos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y también vende frutas y verduras que siembra en su propia finca, trabaja todos los días en su negocio para ganarse honradamente el sustento diario; Concepción es una mujer emprendedora y muy audaz siempre está buscando lo mejor para su familia; en su vivienda desde hace algunos meses se decidió a realizar algunas reparaciones en la entrada principal de la casa pues esta algo deteriorada, desea hacer unas gradas y levantar un muro que le dé más seguridad; espera empezar con el trabajo lo más rápido posible, pero debido a sus bajos recursos no puede costear el gasto de materiales  por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos, hierro. Concepción está muy contenta con la ayuda y espera corresponder con los pagos establecidos.
texts.en:
Concepción is a 54-year old woman who lives with her four children and grandchildren in her own house. She sells tortillas as well as fruits and veggies that she grows in her field. She works in her business everyday to honorably earn a living. 

Concepción is an entrepreneurial and audacious woman who is always looking to provide the best to her family. Some months ago, she decided to make some improvements to her home's main entrance, which is damaged. She also wants to make stairs and a wall that would give them more security. She would like to start the works as soon as possible but, due to her limited resources, she cannot cover the cost of the materials she needs. This is why she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron. Concepción is very happy with the support provided and commits to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron.

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    NAFAMA est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et. 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2éme prêt. Le précédent prêt à été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  d’articles divers à l’image de KOROTOUMOU qui est la 1ére de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, des savons,du thé ,du sucre, des cigarettes, du lait et des  conserves avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The NAFAMA group consists of six married women who average 33 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the district of HEREMAKONO CENTRE, city of Bougouni. They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through their commercial activities.  

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to bolster their working capital and better conduct their activities, and this is their 2nd loan cycle with the MFI. The previous loan was correctly repaid. 

The group members sell miscellaneous products. KOROTOUMOU, first from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy soaps, tea, sugar, cigarettes, milk and canned goods from Bougouni wholesalers. She conducts her retail sales from her home and at the market, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Muhammed's Group

texts.en:
Muhammed is a father of five children that he is raising with his wife in South Iraq. He is 43 years old and for the past ten years he has been making a living, selling bricks and construction materials.  

He would like to increase his stock to be able to sell more bricks at one time and better meet the needs of his customers. By having more materials to sell at one time, he can ensure that his customers won't be shopping at many places, but will acquire all their construction materials from him. To be able to purchase a larger quantity of goods for retail, Muhammed is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and are, thereby, unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Otgon-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Otgon-Erdene, 47 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been working as a harvester and sales manager respectively in a private firm which plants vegetables in large amounts and sells them later to other firms. This summer they began making renovations to their house but due to a lack of fiances, Otgon-Erdene couldn't afford to purchase necessary furniture such as a table, a chair, cabinets and beds. Now he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase those materials. After installing the furniture, his house will be more comfortable to live in and he and his wife will be enthusiastic for their hard work.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Maira Del Carmen

texts.es: Maira del Carmen de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad, uno de 10 años y otro de 3 años en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tostadas y tamales, trabaja día a día para sostener el hogar, además su esposo le ayuda con los gastos; Maira del Carmen es una mujer entregada a su labor y a su familia, quiere darles lo mejor  pero siempre en la medida de sus posibilidades, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural y desde hace algún tiempo quiere construir un muro de retención para evitar algún deslave por las lluvias, espera poder empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero no cuenta con los recursos para poder costear los gastos de materiales ya que su primer crédito con FUSAI lo ocupo para construir un chalet  por eso hoy solita un nuevo  crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, grava y hierro. Maira del Carmen está muy feliz con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maira del Carmen, 27, lives together with her life partner and two underage children who are 10 and 3 in a house of their own. She sells pupusas [thick corn tortillas], tostadas [crispy tortillas with toppings] and tamales, working every day to support her family. Her husband helps her with the home expenses.

Maira del Carmen is a woman devoted to her job and to her family. She wants to provide them with the best, but she is aware of her limitations. Their house is located in a rural area and she has been thinking for a while that she wants to build a retaining wall in order to prevent a landslide from happening because of the rain. She hopes to be able to start the works as soon as possible but does not have enough resources to cover the cost of the construction materials.

She used her first loan from FUSAI to build a cottage and is now requesting a new loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel and iron. Maira del Carmen feels happy with the help she is receiving and promises to pay back the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel and iron.

loans.name: Nyamtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Nyamtsetseg, 29 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an operator at a private firm since 2012 and recently took her maternity leave. Her husband delivers pizza around the city. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, bricks, cement and fiberglass. Using those materials, her husband will do the renovation to their old house, making it a comfortable and warm place. Due to less heat loss through walls and windows, the family will begin to burn less coal for heating thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 48-year-old man and the father of one child whom he loves very much. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating an electrical workshop for many years. He has employed three workers who assist him in his business and offer services to customers. He provides services for a living and is proud of the good work being carried out. He gained experience in one electrical workshop, which enabled him to own his own electrical workshop. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to buy electrical spare parts for his business in order to fix different cars of his clients. He hopes his family can confide in him and help him to improve as a person.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts for his business

loans.name: Mwila

texts.en:
Mwila is 26 years old and was born into a family of six.  Now, she has a two-year-old son and lives in the town of Chipata, Zambia.  Mwila is a successful micro-entrepreneur who has been operating her own Zoona mobile money transfer business since receiving a Kiva loan in mid 2012.  

Currently, Mwila employs one other individual to assist in the day-to-day operations of her business; she hopes to employ more people in the future as her business grows.  Mwila takes pride in her Zoona business and strives to create an atmosphere that is welcoming to her customers and keeps them coming back.  She enjoys the opportunity that comes with being responsible for the success of her small enterprise.  With Zoona’s platform, Mwila says her business has the competitive advantage of being cheap, fast, and easier to use compared to other competitors.  

Upon receiving the loan, Mwila plans to obtain a new trading booth to set up operations in the small town of Nyimba, located in the eastern province of Zambia.  This new location Mwila believes will bring additional profit and growth to her business.  She’s hopeful that as her business expands it will enable her to take good care of her growing son.  Mwila is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To obtain a trading booth so that she can expand her mobile money transfer business to another town

loans.name: Lubaga North Group

texts.en:
Onesmus is 32 years old, a resident of the city outskirts. He looks after his mother and siblings in the village.  

Onesmus left his mother and siblings in the village in 1996 and come to Kampala to look for a formal job that would pay him well and enable him to provide for his family that was starving. Having failed to get a job, Onesmus decided to start up a small retail shop business which has steadily grown. The shop deals in daily household use items  like salt, sugar, and soap among other items.

Onesmus however needs a loan to boost his business and enable him to realize his dream of having a supermarket in the near future.He is hard-working and hopes to be able to create employment for his sister in the near future.

loans.use: To buy household use items

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en: Edward is the featured borrower of this group; he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana, and has always been neighbors and friends with the other group members. Edward has been manufacturing and selling cream for three years, with a special expertise in the sale of fast food too. He is a 38-year-old married father of two children. He has very good experience in his domain; that's why he is requesting a loan amount of 2000 from Kiva partner ID-Ghana to buy a chemicals which will be used produce the cream so that he can develop his business. It will improve both his business and family situation. Edward is standing on the right of the photograph with Fati on the far left and Christiana in the middle; they sell jewelry and flour respectively. They need a total amount of GHS 3800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a chemicals which will be used to produce cream for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Obama 3 Group

texts.en:
Farook is 29 years old, a resident of Waswa zone Kibuye one, Makindye. Farook is carrying out a business of carpentry, specifically dealing in sideboards. He started his business four years ago when he felt it would not be possible for him to generate some income to sustain his family because he was tired of working for others since he was being paid little money that could not sustain his family.

Farook has no regrets as to why he started the business because it has kept on growing and his belief is that as long as he can get more to add in capital, the sky is the limit. Therefore, he has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to add capital to his business and buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en:
Habibu, a 34 year old married man, grew up in a polygamous family; he was forced to start fending for himself early since he did not go far with school. He is a resident of a suburb of Kampala city, married with 2 children who attend school, and he takes care of his two sisters and pays for their school fees. 

Habibu deals in a business of spare parts for motorcycles which is strategically located in the busy city centre He started the business in 2010 with an aim of stimulating his daily income and to have widened businesses. He got a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more stock to serve his clients better due to an increased demand for spare parts in the town. Habibu sells mostly to motorcycle riders who come from different parts of towns. He however faces challenges of inadequate capital competition in the market.

Habibu is such a determined and committed man, and aims at acquiring more loans to boost his business so that it attains consistent growth and expansion so that his children can have a better education and future.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts for his business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association DEME de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de légumes à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue et appréciée  à N’TENTOU, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes : poivre, concentrée de tomate, oignon, choux et aubergine.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of the association "DEME de N’TENTOU". It comprises five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. They average 40 years of age and five children each, and they run different businesses, such as selling condiments and vegetables, just like FATOUMATA, who is the second person standing from the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in N’TENTOU, in Préfecture de Kati, Région de Koulikoro (in the Republic of Mali). 

The women have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are in high demand in their work. Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan Soro Yiriwaso program three years ago. They are now on their sixth solidarity loan.

FATOUMATA is the president of the group, and she is well-known and appreciated in N’TENTOU. She intends to use her loan to purchase condiments of different sorts: black pepper, tomato paste, onions, cabbage, and eggplant.  She gets her supplies from Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credits, she sells retail to a customer base composed of men and women in OUELESSEBOUGOU.

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more quality African dresses, slippers, Lappa (African cloths mostly use by women), and artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Née vers 1975, FANTA vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
FANTA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce de céréales. FANTA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales et produits agricoles : arachide, niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents, FANTA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 de fonio auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, KELEYA et OUROUN) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
FANTA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1975, FANTA lives with her seven children and her husband in a nuclear family in  Commune Rurale de Ouelessebougou. She soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses along side her aunt, who used to do commerce in grains. After several years of experience with her aunt, FANTA opted for buying and selling grains and farm produce: peanuts, black-eye peas, millet, fonio, corn, dah, etc.

After having correctly repaid the two previous loans, FANTA is on her third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 100 of fonio (a kind of millet) from peasant producers (in OUELESSEBOUGOU, KELEYA, and OUROUN) and rarely from local wholesalers. She makes her cash or credit sales at the retail level to a customer base compose essentially of consumers at her home, at the market, and at the surrounding fairs.

FANTA hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to help her husband to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase gains to sell

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mambehe est une commerçante et membre d’une association  d’affaires  «Jipe Moyo », femme mariée, âgée  de 35 ans, mère des cinq enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de braises.  Son conjoint, c’est un  ajusteur Soudeur. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter  4 sacs de  braises pour accroitre ses activités.  Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir,  elle souhaite construire une jolie maison pour sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs en leur accordant des microcrédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
This client, Mambehe, is a merchant and a member of the business association "Jipe Moyo". She is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of five children, all in school. She is a vendor of charcoal. Her husband is a welder-adjuster. 

Mambehe is requesting a loan from Hekima. She is going to purchase 4 sacks of charcoal to grow her business. She had started off with her own funds gotten from her husband. For the future, she would like to build a beautiful house for her family. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs by granting them micro-loans without the need for collateral.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Bazar

texts.ru: Базару 42 года. Она разведена и имеет 4 детей. Базар более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур, как лук, рис и т.п. Базар работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Базар дополнительно занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает крупно - рогатого скота и мелко – рогатого скота. Базар имеет 2 коровы и 2 барана. Она должна сделать осенний посев. Ее дочь и сын помогают ей по введению бизнеса. Базар не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bazar is 42 years old.  She is divorced and has four children.  Bazar has been involved in growing agricultural crops, such as onions, rice, etc., for over 15 years.  She works hard from an early morning until late evening.  Bazar is also involved in animal husbandry.  She fattens up cattle and small livestock.  Bazar has 2 cows and 2 rams.  She has to make the autumn sowing.  Her daughter and son help her with running the business.  Bazar does not have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods (toothpaste, body cream, door lock, bath and washing soaps, rice, sardines, and others items) for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 37 years old and lives with her family in the village Achajur, which is in the Tavush region. She has a school-age daughter and a son. Her husband works as a driver at a private company. 

Eliza is a very hardworking and resourceful woman. She is engaged in farming and agriculture, and she takes orders of making different cakes and biscuits at her house. 

Eliza greatly wants to enlarge her farm cattle since she has only a cow and ten chickens. She sells milk and Macun (Armenian national dairy product) right from her house.

Eliza asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and animal fodder for the upcoming winter cold months. She has already once taken a loan from Nor Horizon, and she has paid it back without any delays.

loans.use: to buy two cows and animal fodder for the upcoming winter cold months.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en: Phiona is a 53-year-old married woman with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda.Three years ago she decided to start a beauty salon and her business has been very profitable. She also sells clothes to earn extra income. Like most good mothers, she desires to educate her children to the university level while running her beauty parlor. The high cost of rent and inadequate capital are her major challenges. Phiona intends to use this loan to buy hair driers to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair driers to use in her salon.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттору 20 лет. Он умный и начитанный молодой человек. Абдусаттор студент 1 курса Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он учится в факультете Каналы связи и информации по специальности Информационная система и технология в экономике. Он окончил среднюю школу с отличными оценками и в университете тоже имеет хорошую успеваемость. Он часто посещает библиотеку и интернет кафе. Он должен оплатить учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdusattor is 20 years old.  He is smart and well-read person.  Abdusattor is a first-year student of the Tajikistan Technology University.  He studies in the Communications and Information department with the Information Systems and Technology in Economics major.  He graduated from a secondary school with excellent grades and studies well in the university as well.  He frequently visits a library and an internet cafe.  He has to pay for his tuition.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 900 US dollars to pay for his university tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia del Carmen de sesenta y uno años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella trabaja duro lavando y planchando ajeno para ganarse el sustento día a día, también sus hijos que son mayores de edad le ayudan con los gastos. Julia del Carmen es una mujer entregada a su labor, honrada y sobre todo responsable, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural, es una casa humilde que necesita algunas reparaciones, quiere arreglar el techo ya que está muy deteriorado y les da inseguridad, además se filtra el agua,  pero debido a su baja condición económica no posee de capital para costear los gastos  de material y la mano de obra por eso le solicita  FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar, lámina galvanizada, madera para los polines y el pago de mano de obra. Julia del Carmen está muy feliz con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen is 61 years old and lives with her two children in her own house.  She works hard washing and ironing for others so she can obtain income every day.  In addition, her children are grown and help her with the household expenses.  Julia del Carmen is very dedicated to her work and is honest and above all responsible.  Her house is located in a rural area and is a humble house that needs some repairs.  She wants to repair her roof since it is in great disrepair and isn't safe for them (water leaks through it).  Due to her modest financial circumstances, she doesn't have the money to pay for the materials or the labor.

For this reason, she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood for the beams and also pay to have her roof fixed.  Julia del Carmen is very happy for the help and promises to pay back her debt.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheet metal and wood for roof beams and also pay a roofer.

loans.name: Hasanboy

texts.ru:
Хасанбой опытный садовод, проживающий в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 55 лет. Он имеет виноградник, за которым ухаживают он, его жена и дети. То есть выращивание винограда является их семейным бизнесом. Около 18 лет Хасанбой у себя дома выращивает виноград. Он настолько влюблен в свою работу, что хочет работать еще столько лет. Вы можете увидеть некоторые плоды его трудов на фотографии. Параллельно с этим он работает на алюминиевом заводе своего города. 
Сейчас Хасанбой намерен расширить свой виноградный сад. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа саженцев винограда.
texts.en: Hasanboy is an experienced gardener living in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 55 years old.  He has a vineyard that he, his wife and children take care of.  Growing grapes is their family business.  Hasanboy has been growing grapes for about 18 years at home.  He loves his work so much that he wants to work just as many more years.  You can see the fruits of his labor on the photograph.  Concurrently, he works at the aluminium plant in his city.  Currently, Hasanboy intends to expand his vineyard.  He is requesting this loan to purchase grape vines.

loans.use: to purchase grape vines in order to expand his vineyard

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of 4. Her husband works in a governmental entity. She lives with her family at a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. 

Nemat has been selling blankets for a year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy blankets. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends. 

Now she wants to add variety to her products, such as clothes, and buy a larger amount of blankets in order to attract more customers and raise her profit and income, to be able to help her husband cover their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add variety to her products, such as clothes, and buy a larger amount of blankets.

loans.name: Angel Alberto

texts.es: Angel Alberto de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su tío en casa propia. El trabaja como ayudante de un albañil, también su tío trabaja y le ayuda a completar gastos en el hogar, Angel Alberto es un joven emprendedor, capaz y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace algún tiempo empezó la construcción de su vivienda pero no logró terminarla, necesita colocar el techo y el piso, se ahorrara la mano de obra,  quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero debido a su condición económica no posee de capital que lo respalde para la compra de los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar, lámina galvanizada, polines,  cemento, arena, hierro y ladrillo para piso.  Angel Alberto está muy contento con la ayuda y se siente comprometido a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Twenty-two year old Angel Alberto lives with his uncle in his own home. He works as a bricklayer's assistant. His uncle also works and helps cover the household expenses. 

Angel Alberto is a young, capable entrepreneur, who is eager to move forward. He began building his house some time ago but he wasn't able to finish it. He needs to put in the ceiling and the floor. He will save himself the cost of labour. He wants to start the work as soon as possible, but due to his economic situation he does not have the capital to purchase the materials. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corrugated metal roofing, purlins, cement, sand, iron and tiles for the floor.

 Angel Alberto is very happy to have the help and is committed to repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing, purlins, cement, sand, iron and ceramic floor.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Consequently, her husband appears in the photo.

Rana is a 31-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter, all of whom are under 10. Rana's hsuband is an employee in the public sector and earns a very low income. Rana and her husband would like to improve their home and buy all the necessary materials. Rana took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without electricity expenses.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Soud

texts.en:
Soud is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three kids, two sons and one daughter, in a simple house. Soud is an employee in a local firm where he gets a very low income. He would like for his children to complete their studies and have a better future, but he does not have enough money for the university costs. His son studies Publishing and his daughter studies Business. 

Sould took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of the university installments for his son and daughter. This will help them to complete their studies and find a good job in the future. 

Soud is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the university installments for his son and daughter.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Maryam is a 20-year-old single young lady from Rafah city. She lives with her parents in a simple house. Her father is an employee and this is the only source of income to the family. Maryam is a student in a local university where she studies Technological Sciences. 

She is a very clever girl and she would like to complete her studies and get a good job in the future to help her family. So she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Maryam will be able to do her homework and write reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods in order to increase the range of her sales.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar is 21 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her husband and son. Her husband is in the military. 

Azhar is studying for a Bachelor of Accounting, 4th year. She is planning to get her Bachelor's degree in order to work in her study field after graduation. She wants to start helping her husband cover their son's needs as her husband is currently facing financial crisis, which is not helping him pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia desde hace trece años. El trabaja de albañil y su esposa vende tortillas y pasteles todos los días, entre los dos logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar; Pedro Antonio es un hombre muy emprendedor y responsable; su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural, es muy humilde y desde hace algún tiempo él quiere reconstruir el baño para poder adaptarlo a las aguas negras del lugar, además quiere hacerlo con paredes de ladrillo de bloque y poner una nueva lámina, pero debido a su situación económica no ha contado con los recursos suficientes, desea realizar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero necesita capital para la compra de materiales, por eso solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro, lámina galvanizada, se ahorrara la mano de obra. Pedro Antonio está muy contento con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar en el periodo establecido.
texts.en:
35-year old Pedro Antonio has lived with his wife and two children in their own house for thirteen years. He works in construction and his wife sells tortillas and baking every day. Between the two of them they manage to pay household expenses.

Pedro Antonio is an enterprising, responsible man. His simple home is located in a rural area. For some time now he has wanted to build rebuild the bathroom so it can be connected to the sewage system. He also wants to add cinderblock walls and new laminate sheeting. However, because of his economic situation, Pedro Antonio cannot afford these improvements. He would like to do the work as soon as possible but he needs a loan to buy the materials. For this reason he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, corrugated iron, and galvanized sheeting. He will save money by doing the work himself.

Pedro Antonio is very pleased to get this help and promises to pay back the loan according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, corrugated iron, and galvanized laminate

loans.name: Massaba

texts.fr:
Née en 1960 à N’PIEBOUGOU, MASSABA vit avec ses huit  enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle dans le quartier SEGUESSONA de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite MASSABA s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance de BAMAKO et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
MASSABA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MASSABA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in N’PIEBOUGOU, MASSABA lives with her eight children and husband in a traditional families in the SEGUESSONA district of Ouelessebougou City. Not having had the chance to advance in her studies, MASSABA soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in buying and selling clothing from Bamako and Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from Lomé (in Togo). 

MASSABA is on her third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 50 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail to a customer base composed of men and women at home, at the market, and at surrounding fairs (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya). MASSABA hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help her husband to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   MIRIYA est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sido. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 15éme prêt. Les 14 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  tissus
à l’image de FANTA qui est la 1ére de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 mètres de bazin avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Miriya consists of 4 women, all married, 50 years old on average, with 4 children on average. The live in traditional extended families in the town of Sido.

They met through neighborhood, friendship and business ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better do business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their 15th loan. The 14 previous loans were correctly repaid. 

This group of women sells fabric just like Fanta who is the first person from left to right [in the photo]. With her loan she plans to buy 50 meters of damask cloth from the wholesalers in Bamako.

She sells at the market and from home, retail for cash and credit to a clientele which consists mainly of women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be invested in the businesses and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 39-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a humble house. Wisam is an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. Wisam would like to improve his home conditions and buy all the needed things.
 
Wisam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. It is very necessary since the water in his area is not healthy, and his kids are very sensitive.

Wisam would like to take another loan in the future and buy all the needed stuff. 
Wisam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home, as his kids are very sensitive to the unhealthy water in his area.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 57 years old, widowed, and has four adult children.  She opened her retail store in 2003.

Prescila is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase grocery items such as needles, threads, soft drinks, alcohol, and generic medicines. Her aim is to add to the inventory she offers, which would result in greater costumer satisfaction. She knows that through a complete store of grocery items she can earn an increased income, which enables her to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as needles, threads, soft drinks, alcohol, and medicines

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa,' which can be chewed like tobacco. She has no children and has been raising livestock for 15 years. Her primary income sources are eggs and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling farm products." Her biggest challenge is: "Competition." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Molly."

Jane was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Low interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "Offers financial services to smallholder farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked: "How will this loan benefit your family?," Jane replied: "Improved living standards."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but she does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, and DVD,' but she does not have 'solar power.'

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en: Kaycee is 25 years old and still single. She lives with her parents, three siblings, and her grandfather. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost six years. With this business she earns a net income of 300 PHP a day. She decided to apply for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase eight dozen beverages. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase eight dozen beverages

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single young man from Gaza city. he lives with his parents in a simple house. His father is an employee and this is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies Publishing. 

He is a very clever boy and he would like to complete his studies and get a good job in the future to help his family. So he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. Ahmad appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sura

texts.en:
Sura is a 20-year-old single young lady from Qalqilia city. She lives with her parents in a simple house. Her father is a worker with a very low wage. This is the only source of income for the family. Sura is a student in a local university where she studies Medical Science. 

She is a very clever lady and she would like to complete her studies and get a good job in the future to help her family. So she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. Sura appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Adam

texts.fr:
Né en 1971 à BOUGOUNI, ADAM vit avec son mari et son enfant dans  une  famille traditionnelle  dans la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite ADAM s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des légumes et condiment alimentaire.   
ADAM est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  des légumes et condiment alimentaire tels que le poivre, le poivron, la carotte, le chou, la tomate, l’aubergine, les concentrées de tomate et les cubes maggi  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
ADAM espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Bougouni, Adam lives with her husband and child in a traditional family n the town of Ouelessebougou. Lacking the opportunity to continue her studies, she quickly started earning a living, in particular buying and reselling vegetables and food condiments. Adam is on her fourth loan with Soro Yirwaso, which will be used to by vegetables and food condiments such as pepper, bell peppers, carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant (aubergines), tomato concentrates and Maggi bouillon (stock) cubes from wholesalers. She sells retail, for cash and on credit, out of her home, at the local marketplace and on market days in the nearby villages (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya), to a mixed clientele.
Adam hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for the needs of her family, repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 23-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a humble house. Hamzeh is an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. Hamzeh would like to improve his home conditions and buy all the needed things.
 
Hamzeh took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. It is very necessary since the water in his area is not healthy.
 
Hamzeh would like to take another loan in the future and buy all the needed stuff. 
Hamzeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a necessary water purification machine for his home, as the water in his area is not healthy.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
 
Suha is a 28-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She is a mother with two sons and one daughter. For the past three years, Suha and her husband have operated a small grocery store in the city where they sell basic products like sugar, rice and dairy milk. 

Suha requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to improve the grocery store she and her husband own by buying more products to sell. This will increase their income and also improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is 46 years old. She lives in Ijevan city. She is married and she has a school-aged son. Her husband is now abroad. Gyulnara graduated Yerevan chemistry-technology college, pharmaceutical department, but she has been engaged in a clothing sales business since 1990. Gyulnara sells a large variety of clothes: men's and women's clothes, children's clothes, bedspreads, towels and pillows. All these she brings from Turkey once or twice a month. 

She rents a stall near the center of their city, where she already has loyal customers, and her stall has become very popular during these years.
Gyulnara is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of seasonal clothes for her business. In Nor Horizon Gyulnara has successfully paid back  four loans already.

loans.use: to buy a lot of seasonal clothes for her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this farming work for 22 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, job salary, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming.' His biggest challenge is 'Transportation  costs.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kanini  & Kairu.'

Elias was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Interest on a reducing balance.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'offers financial services to smallholder farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Elias replied, 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Elias owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa was born in 1985. She is single and lives with her three siblings and her parents in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. Randa has been selling home products for one year. She started her business at home, selling a small quantity of products when she realized that her family was facing financial problems. So she decided to help them. Now, she is planning to buy a larger quantity of home products to increase her profits and income and to be a good source of financial support for her family. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products for resale.

loans.name: Thmar Al-Mahariq Group

texts.en:
Thmar Al-Mahariq is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They are women who work hard in order to increase their income. 

Nahd is a 24-year-old married woman who lives with her three children in poor conditions in Aden, Yemen. She is a housewife who intends to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She said the amount she has is not enough to buy what she needs. Therefore, she requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards and to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABALY est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Kokélé. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7éme prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de SIRADIE qui est la 1ére   de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50Kg de sel et 20 Kg de poissons fumé et séché  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Sabaly consists of 5 women who are all married and on average 35 years old with 6 children. They live in traditional extended families in the town of Kokélé.

They met through neighborhood, friendship and business ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better do business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their 7th loan. The 6 previous loans were correctly repaid.

This group of women sells condiments, just like Siradie who is the 1st person from left to right [in the photo]. With her loan she plans to buy 50 kg of salt and 20 kg of smoked and dried fish from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells at the market and from home, retail for cash and credit to a clientele which consists mainly of women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which will be invested in the businesses and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Baris

texts.en:
Baris lives in the village Atcharkut in Tavush region. Baris now lives with his daughter, son-in-law and grandchildren (two girls and a boy). Boris’ wife died several years ago. His daughter works at home; she takes care of the children and their house. His son-in-law gives constructional paid services. Baris graduated from the Machinery College in Yerevan city and for many years he worked as a senior master mechanic at different factories and private companies. Now Baris works as a taxi driver using his own car and he already has many loyal customers from his and nearby villages, but the problem is that his car is too worn-out and it has become uncomfortable for his customers.

Baris is asking for a loan of 2000 US dollars in order to buy a new car since sooner or later he may lose his passengers because of the bad condition of his car and big competition from different taxi drivers.

loans.use: to buy a new car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en: Hrayr is 49 years old and lives in Spitak City, which is in the Lori region of Armenia. Hrayr is married and has two children. His son is already 24 years old and has lived in Georgia for some time. Hrayr's daughter is still school-aged. Hrayr has run his own business for five years already. He rents a stall near the center of their city where he sells fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers, green peppers, eggplants, apples, grapes, peaches, pears, plums, etc.). Even though Hrayr’s wife works as a nurse at the hospital, she still manages to help her husband with his business. When Hrayr travels to procure new fresh products for his stall, she works there in his place. Hrayr says his customers know that in his stall they can find a variety of fresh products and good customer service. Hrayr requested a loan of 550,000 AMD to buy a variety of citrus from Georgia to sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of citrus fruit from Georgia to sell

loans.name: Nelson Omar

texts.es: Nelson Omar de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su madre en casa propia. El realiza actividades agrícolas, ayuda en un camión y es jornalero además su madre lo ayuda con los gastos vendiendo tortillas y pupusas; Nelson sabe que no es fácil salir adelante, pero se mantiene constante en el trabajo, siempre buscando oportunidades que le den una vida mejor; su vivienda está ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad, en una zona rural, necesita ponerle una verja de varilla doble a la fachada de la casa con una pequeña pestaña (saliente o alero) de lamina, no posee los fondos necesarios para los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, lamina, polines. Nelson Omar está muy feliz con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar toda la deuda.
texts.en:
Nelson Omar is 26 years old and lives with his mother in their own house. He works in agriculture, helps run a truck, and is a day labourer. His mother also helps pay for expenses through her job selling different kinds of tortillas.

Nelson knows that it’s not easy to get ahead in life, but he always has a job and is always seeking opportunities that will give him a better life. 

His home is located on the outskirts of town in a rural neighbourhood. He needs to put a chain-link fence with a small ledge and projecting eaves on the front of his house, but as he cannot afford to buy the materials, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy iron, metal sheeting, and poles.

Nelson is very pleased to get this help and promises to pay back all of the money.

loans.use: buy iron, metal sheeting, and poles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.
